Would you like to help organize meetups for the Knapsack group?  Here's a great opportunity to get involved and help set the schedule for the winter.  Bring your ideas and be ready to get busy!

People who attend would be eligible to become organizers.  You will learn more about the expectations for organizers when you come.

Note: if you have not met the requirement of attending three or more of our discussion meetups in the six months prior to this meetup, including one Accountability Session, you are welcome to add your ideas for meetups in the comments area, or share with an organizer.  We hope you will attend more things in the coming months!

Accessibility Information: Pappenheim Library at Community Change, Inc. is wheelchair accessible with the following limitations.  The door to the building is heavy and does not have a button to open it. The elevator doors are slightly more than 30 inches wide.  The sixth floor bathrooms are not wheelchair accessible, but the first floor bathroom is.  During regular hours there are usually two tables in the library which limit mobility, but these are normally moved elsewhere during Knapsack events.  Please let us know your needs so we can help make the event accessible for you.
results.name: Planning winter meetups

results.description:
Every Tuesday at 6:30, if you need a track workout, we'll link up with TMIRCE, (The Most Informal Running Club Ever). This is an open track workout. Don't let the RSVPs fool you, there are usually over 20 people there! No matter your ability level, you'll be able to go at your own pace and meet other endurance enthusiasts. The group usually goes out for beer afterwards.

Look for me or Andy Marx. Click here for the track location. We meet at the area on the track marked by the red X.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

It's a 400 Meter Track. We run intervals (200, 400, 800...etc) with a recovery pace in between. The workout will be explained to everyone before the start. We often run at 5k pace or faster. If you would like to know your 5k pace click this link for the Interval pace calculator.

If you're newer to running or nursing and injury slow your pace accordingly and/or take extended recoveries.

Hope to see you there!

 

Here is Active.com's reasons to love the Oval!

 

3 Reasons to Love The Oval


1) PROPER PACING
On a treadmill, the belt keeps you on pace, even if your energy fades.
"You're just keeping up with what's moving underneath you," says
Marius Maianu, a clinical exercise physiologist at the Cooper Clinic
in Dallas. By contrast, hitting a certain pace on the track requires
more mental effort.

2) POSITIVE PEER PRESSURE
At a group workout, you're likely to push harder than you might on
your own. You're also less likely to give up when the going gets
tough. Other runners at the workout can spot sloppy form that might be
slowing you down.

3) THE FUN FACTOR
Track may be about speed, but at most workouts organized by running
clubs, the vibe stays social and supportive. The track is a great
place to meet new running buddies—the kind who help you get out the
door in epic conditions, or tough out a long run.
results.how_to_find_us: Area on the map marked with an X. There you will find TMIRCE
results.name: Outdoor Track Running with TMIRCE

results.description:
Interested in Node.js, but don't know where to start or how to find time to learn it properly? Want to create web applications using JavaScript on both the front and back end? Want to create your first API? Curious how it's even possible to run JavaScript outside of the browser?


There are many benefits of having Node.js experience:

If you are a front-end developer now, you will have the ability to work on the back-end in the same language you are already familiar with: JavaScript.

If you are a back-end developer now, you’ll learn ways to jumpstart your application development and quickly prototype new applications

This class takes place over four consecutive Tuesday evenings, as follows:

November 10th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

November 17th - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

November 24th  - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

December 1st - 6:30pm to 8:30pm

On Monday, November 9th we will hold an optional install night at Maxwell Health to ensure all the students are setup and prepared to begin class on Tuesday, November 10th. If you do not attend this session, please ensure you install all programs listed under "preparation" independently.

Your payment registers you for the entire series.

CLASS OVERVIEW

Class 1 - I/O & HTTP with node

Class 2 - Modular development & Express

Class 3 - Using an external API

Class 4 - Connecting your API to a database

PREREQS & PREPARATION

This will be a very hands on class, so an intermediate understanding of JavaScript is required. (If you have any questions on this, please don't hesitate to reach out to 'boston' @ 'girldevelopit.com' )

Please bring along a laptop and charger as well as have the following programs installed prior to arriving:

• A text editor. We recommend Sublime Text 3 (free; available for Mac, PC, and Linux)

• node.js

• Create an account on Github and install Git. For an intro to Git you can read this or try this interactive tutorial

Note: For those who do not feel comfortable installing and configuring these tools on their own, we will have an optional install night on Monday, November 9th at Maxwell Health from 6:30 - 7:30pm.

LOCATION

All four classes will take place at Maxwell Health, located at:

101 Tremont Street (11th Fl)
Boston, MA 02108

For those using public transportation, take the T to the Park Street stop and the office is a short walk from there. Please sign in at the desk on the 11th floor upon arrival.


FINANCIAL NEED

A limited number of scholarships are available for those with a financial hardship. To apply, click here. Scholarship applicants will be notified shortly after the deadline. Class capacity does not impact scholarship students. Check out this info sheet about getting course fees covered by your employer.

YOUR TEACHER


Emma Spencer is a full stack developer at Maxwell Health. She graduated college in 2012 with a degree in archaeology and spent 1 year working a variety of jobs before deciding she wanted to learn to code. She was a student in the first Boston cohort of General Assembly’s Web Development Immersive course. After completing the course she was an intern at Maxwell and was quickly hired full time. She primarily codes in node and occasionally PHP.

TEACHING ASSISTANTS

If you are interested in being a teaching assistant for this workshop, please contact an event host. TAing is a great way to practice what you know and to get to know members of our community.

All attendees are expected to abide by the Girl Develop It Code of Conduct.

results.description:
ABOUT THIS CLASS

Have you spent some time practicing beginner HTML and CSS but are ready for the next step? Itching to find out about modern techniques? 


Whether you'd like to improve your current site or build a site from scratch, we are here to help. Join us for this 4-class series starting in November.

This course is perfect for anyone who is comfortable with basic HTML and CSS, but wants to learn how it all comes together. We’ll also try some fun advanced techniques, including responsive web development (RWD) and modern HTML5 and CSS3 features.

This class takes place over four consecutive Tuesday evenings, as follows:


November 10th, 6:30-8:30pm

November 17th, 6:30-8:30pm


November 24th, 6:30-8:30pm

December 1st, 6:30-8:30pm

Note: This class will be limited to 20 students. Register early to secure your spot. 


TAKEAWAYS

In this class, we'll be creating a website and enhancing it with all the new hotness: HTML5 for semantic structure and CSS3 for sweet visual flourishes like gradients, rounded corners, and drop shadows. The latest CSS specification provides advanced selectors, graphical enhancements, and better font support that make our sites more visually appealing without using font image replacement techniques, complex JavaScript, or graphics tools.

We'll also try out some more advanced techniques, like CSS animations and responsive design, and we'll talk about some flashy HTML5 features that do require JavaScript.


IS THIS CLASS FOR ME?

To get the most out of this class, you should be comfortable building simple webpages with basic HTML and CSS. You may have taken Intro to HTML or Code Your Own Website, Part I through Girl Develop It, or maybe you have built a site for fun. If you're unsure if you're ready, reach out to our teacher by commenting below! 

To help with the process, we ask all participants to take this quiz before purchasing a spot in the class. Getting a score of at least 70% should allow you to follow along comfortably in the class. A review will be provided before we start the new material and you can view the material from our class on our website. If you have additional questions, feel free to post them below.

Note: Attending Code Your Own Website, Part I is not required -- anyone comfortable with basic HTML and CSS is welcome! 

LOCATION

A HUGE thank you to MedTouch for hosting this event! MedTouch is located at:

86 Sherman Street
Brickyard Office Park
Cambridge, MA 02140
View Google Map

MedTouch is a 15 minute walk from Porter Station on the red line. Free parking is available in the Brickyard office park, where MedTouch is located.

</a>

PREREQS & PREPARATION

In addition to bringing a laptop and charger with you to each class, please be sure to have the following programs installed before arriving:

• Text Editor (we recommend <a href="https://atom.io/">Atom or SublimeText)

• Google Chrome web browser  

FINANCIAL NEED

A limited number of scholarships are available for those with a financial hardship. To apply, click here. Scholarship applicants will be notified shortly after the deadline. Class capacity does not impact scholarship students. Check out this info sheet about getting course fees covered by your employer.

YOUR TEACHER

This course will be taught by Liz Shaw.

Liz Shaw is a full-stack web developer who harnesses the power of CSS, Javascript, HTML, C#, and PHP on a daily basis. She's a fan of fast sites, clean code, and mastering the latest and greatest coding techniques. She has developed sites for organizations including The PGA Tour, FOX Sports, Tufts University, and Roger Williams University. She is currently a Senior User Interface Developer at MedTouch, where she delivers usable, sleek responsive websites to the complex, massive world of healthcare. Her work has recently won Interactive Media Awards.

TEACHING ASSISTANTS


We would love to have two Teaching Assistants for this course. Being a TA is a rewarding experience, a great way to meet people, and a wonderful thing to add to a resume. Please reach out to us at boston[at]girldevelopit.com if you are interested and able to TA for this series.

results.description:
From Roger....


Costa Rica Adventure Tour Info Session - learn about how you can go to Costa Rica for 7 nights for as little as $499. (plus airfare) I just booked my flight for $355 on Southwest. The package I'll be doing will cost about $1100 and will include Paddleboarding (SUP), accommodations, ground transportation, Guided Jungle flora trek (hike), Guided river walk, Horseback riding, Yoga, Beach BBQ, Snorkeling, and more... like Ziplining and a volcano hike.  Who's with me? if we get a few more people we can rent a house on the water with an infinity pool for about the same money. There are many different accommodation from Spartan ($499) to the Taj Mahal ($4,999). So come check it out. Also included is Stacey our local Braintree girl to show us around and give us on the scoop on where to go and what to do. I'm pretty damn psyched. I hope a few more of you can join us. Don't wait these airline rates are ridiculously cheap. 

this is the view from the cheap accommodations... yes right on the beach.


http://supsonas.com/images/546_DSCF2044.JPG

a step up :-)


(Azul Ocean Club Resort, Playa Azul, Guanacaste, Costa Rica)

From Stacey..... Greetings!

Let’s meetup and chat about traveling to Costa Rica together!

As many of you know, I (Stacey) am a former accountant turned competitive stand up paddlesurf competitor, coach and stand up paddleboard instructor who is from Hingham and lives in Braintree in the summer/fall and Costa Rica in the winter/spring organizing vacation packages! Since becoming knowledgeable in Costa Rican culture, activities and accommodations, many of my friends, relatives and members of meetup began asking me to put together trips for them. I have met some of my best friends from traveling with meetup.com and enjoy bringing like-minded people together and now specialize in vacation packages to Guanacaste on the Pacific Coast. Many Scituate residents go to the area of Nosara, near to where I live. I have the story behind that too!

Come join us Tuesday night in Rockland to chat about the upcoming Costa Rica meetup group vacation packages or we will customize your own personal vacation if you don’t feel like traveling with the group. Our packages include whatever activities you would like! You name it, we can include it.

Current set dates for the group vacation packages are:

December 5-12, 2015 (7 Nights)(Or a 5 Nights in between)
February 6-13, 2016 (7 Nights)
February 10-18, 2016 (8 Nights)
February 14-20, 2016 (6 Nights)
March 12-19, 2016 (7 Nights)

You may go whatever dates during the year you would like, however.

Here is a link to some of the accommodations we use, listed in order of least expensive to most luxurious, all of which are within close proximity of each other:
http://www.supsonas.com/costarica/tripaccommodations.html

It is recommended you complete a Trip Questionnaire before arriving. This will help me prepare a quote for you ahead of time or to answers to your questions.
http://www.supsonas.com/costarica/tripquestionnaire.html

Hope to see you there for some wine & cheese (and margaritas) to talk about warm, tropical weather!

Stacey Mac
SUP SONAS
Stand Up Paddleboarding, Surfing & & Vacation Packages
Boston & Costa Rica
www.SUPSONAS.com
www.FACEBOOK.com/SUPSONAS

Business professionals become more effective, authentic and powerful. 

People expand their vision of what life could be like when they are able to

People who suffer from stage fright to overcome their fears.

Hope to see you soon,

Dexter Nardella

At a Speaking Circle you are provided all the support you need to express yourself in your own time and in your own unique way, without fear or discomfort. results.description:
The teaching this evening will explore the inner state of gratitude. We often think of gratitude as something that we feel when someone helps us, or when things go our way. But actually, the deepest form of gratitude is a closely held perspective that this present human life—with all its joys and sorrows—is a gift. To say that life is a gift is to say that everything that happens to us has value. We will explore how gratitude can be consciously cultivated through a threefold process of remembering, appreciating and paying forward. It would not be an exaggeration to say that a simple daily practice of gratitude can change your life.

Contact : [masked]

Teacher Profiles

Lama Willa Miller's bio can be found here.

Please note: most of the friends who attend regularly are not Meetup members, so there are always more people attending than are signed up using this web site.
results.name: Gratitude with Lama Willa Miller

results.description:
The Arlington Street Church invites all OutBreathren to its Tuesday night Zen Center, on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of each month.

The evening includes several short sitting meditations; walking meditation through the gorgeous Arlington Street Church sanctuary and Public Garden; and discussion.

Prior to the Zen Center program at 7 PM is the Buddha' Belly Book Discussion Group at 6 PM.  The group will be reading and discussing Dan Goleman's new book, A Force for Good: The Dalai Lama's Vision for Our World.  OutBreathren who are interested are warmly invited to join the book discussion at 6.

Though not exclusively LGBTQ, this is a super LGBTQ-friendly event. The teacher/facilitator is ASC Senior Minister & uber-awesome lesbian, Rev. Kim K. Crawford Harvie. Rev. Crawford Harvie was previously minister of the UU Meeting House in Provincetown where she was named Provincetown Citizen of the Year. She teaches in the Zen Buddhist tradition.

results.description:
WHY ME?  Understanding Karma                                                                                                          a meditation class series 

TUESDAYS | OCT 13th - NOV 17th


7:00 - 8:30pm

with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher, Kyle Davis

Do you ever wonder why certain things, good or bad, happen to you? How can an understanding of Karma change things for the better?

Karma means ‘action’. Every action we perform leaves an imprint on our very subtle mind and each imprint eventually gives rise to its own effect. Our mind is like a field and performing actions is like sowing seeds in that field. In this series, we will explore Buddha’s teachings on Karma. We will learn how to apply its wisdom into our daily lives in beautiful meditations, so that we can learn to accept our present circumstances and joyfully cultivate our future happiness.

Each class includes a short talk and two guided meditations. Everyone welcome - no experience necessary.  

Drop in anytime! No need to pre-registration. 

Cost | $10 per class / $5 students & seniors.  Members FREE! 

Location | 179 Green Street – Boston, Jamaica Plain, MA 02130

Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.

The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.

The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed. All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

results.description:
The Incredible Dr. You breaks down the basics of "Network Spinal Analysis" (NSA). This class will help enlighten you on just how incredible your body is at healing itself!  

The class is very informative with lots of "wow" moments!  The class is also interactive, hands-on and fun!

NSA is a unique "gentle touch" form of chiropractic. This approach utilizes very specific analysis and adjusting methods. The system incorporates low force adjustments applied at specific points along the spine, as well as very specific positioning of the patient. 

Using this strategy the practitioner is able to assist the neurological system to develop new strategies to:
• Dissipate tension from the spine, nerves and muscles
• Decrease pain and the "defensive posturing" created from past trauma
• Create a more self-correcting, self-reliant nervous system/spine.
• Adapt to stress better
• Improve posture and increase function (such as range of motion)
• Experience greater well being

Network Spinal Analysis is exclusively practiced by doctors of chiropractic and requires additional, extensive post-doctoral training.

results.description:
Meditation practice gives us a chance to step away from the busy-ness of our day-to-day lives. It provides space for us to be free from reaction, from expectation, from doing, and step into the gentle space of being.

This weekly practice consists of 25-30 minutes of guided Vipassana meditation followed by a brief discussion. Vipassana meditation encourages us to experience each moment exactly how it is, fostering presence and awareness.

In this practice we allow thoughts, emotions, and all other stimuli to surface. We become a witness of these, cultivating a space of non-attachment and revealing a deeper connection with one's inner self.

Newcomers to meditation and long-time practitioners are welcome to attend. This is a FREE practice. There is a suggested donation, but that is not required to attend.

results.description:
Hello and welcome to another meeting of the Manga Club! This is your chance to get together and discuss the world of Japanese media by picking a title, reading it, and debating it with others whom have done the same!

Now, to reiterate a previous post, this last August was the THIRD YEAR ANNIVERSARY since these monthly meetings began. During that time period people have come and gone titles both new and old have been debated, and formats have changed dramatically. But in all that time we have always worked exclusively with Manga, or Japanese Comic Books.

Not this time.

Instead, we are going to try an experiment. While this is a Manga Club, our debates have, besides the main title, covered all sorts of Anime as well. A title in Japan can appear in multiple formats, be it Anime, Manga, video games, and so on. For you Haruhi fans who made the debate last December, you might also remember another format which led the way for that production, and would be ideal for an in depth debate, the infamous Light Novel!
Therefore, this month, we are going to try reading an illustrated light novel from the author behind Sword Art Online and Accel World! Reki Kawahara!

The Isolator, Vol. 1
by Reki Kawahara

Ever since a terrible childhood tragedy, Minoru Utsugi has wished for one thing: solitude. Years later, a bizarre encounter leaves a mysterious artifact in Minoru's body that grants his wish--but that's far from the end of his troubles. Others have been visited and given powers like Minoru's, but their twisted desires are not so benign. When a murderous force threatens the people Minoru holds dear, will his newfound abilities be enough to stand in its way? And can there be a future for someone who craves eternal solitude above all else? The story of the Isolator begins here!

A limited number of copies are at the venue, and don’t forget our special deal! On the night of the Manga Club, all participants get ten percent off all graphic novels in the store, and twenty five percent off any future Manga Club title releases in stock! So if you come to the October Manga Club event, you can get the November or December titles for twenty five percent off as available!

BUT PLEASE REMEMBER, THIS DISCOUNT ONLY APPLIES TO VOLUMES IN THE STORE ON THE NIGHT OF A MANGA CLUB EVENT! THIS DISCOUNT DOES NOT APPLY AT ANY OTHER TIME OR TO A PREVIOUSLY RESERVED GRAPHIC NOVEL! THIS DEAL IS A GIFT NOT A PRIVILEGE SO PLEASE DO NOT ABUSE IT!

Thank you and I hope to see you there!
results.name: November Manga Club! Experimental Format!

results.description:
Autumn Theme: Perl 6 for Xmas


Curious about Perl 6? New to Perl? Perl 6 is essentially a new language. It has been in development for over a decade and is a ground-up redesign incorporating modern language design and syntax, while retaining some of the flavor and spirit of Perl. Learn more about it at the Perl 6 site (http://perl6.org/).


This Fall Boston.pm will be hosting several presentations on Perl 6 leading up to its first official 1.0 release this Christmas.


Tuesday November 10,[masked]:30-9:30pm @ MIT E51-376

"Get Ready To Party"

Larry Wall.


Continuing our season series for the December 2015 launch of Perl 6.0.0 ... Larry Wall (appearing by tape delay) presents an introduction to Perl 6 by comparison to Perl 5 and Tolkien. This talk was given at several 2015 conferences and it was the pre-announcement of the "yes *this* Christmas" release. (If you are new to Perl6, and its long development cycle, the running joke answer to the question of "when will Perl 6 be released" is always "Christmas" with no indication of the year.)


We'll have working examples in live Perl6 (Rakudo Perl 6 http://rakudo.org/how-to-get-rakudo/), for kibitzing and tinkering, plus ​our usual lively discussion.


About the speaker

Larry Wall is the creator of Perl.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Larry_Wall


Program notes:

We're planning to have several Perl 6 talks this Fall/Winter, building up to the Perl 6 formal release at Christmas, including:

• P6 Regex & Grammars

• P6 Concurrency and Asynchrony

If you have any Perl 6 code to share, maybe as a mini talk before main talk, or as an intermission, if it fits with a scheduled p6 talk!


Anyone with things to talk about at future meetings, contact Bill and/or Tom.


​Boilerplate details

- Tech Meetings are held on the 2nd Tuesday of every month at MIT building E51, Sloan School Tang Center [not the other Tang building!] nearer to Kendall Sq than Mass Ave. (directions http://boston.pm.org/MIT+Directions).

- Talk begins at 7:30.

- Refreshments in the hallway prior.

- RSVP for count encouraged but not required.

(Technical Support:[masked]) 


Isha Kriya Guided Meditation-

A lot of people find it really difficult to calm the mind and settle the body for meditation when they first try it. Too many people get frustrated and give up on meditation before they can experience its many benefits.

These 1-hour guided sessions offer a simple, but powerful kriya practice that aligns your mind, body, and inner-energies to easily and naturally become meditative. Once meditative, your experience of the life within you and the world around you becomes much deeper and richer. Daily activity becomes effortless and joyful. 

You can easily learn this 12-to-18 minute Isha Kriya process in one session and practice on your own, or return to class to ask questions and deepen the experience with the group. Benefits of regular practice include improving health, energy and vitality; enhancing mental focus, memory and clarity; reducing stress and establishing a deep sense of peace and inner balance.

Isha Kriya is a gentle, seated practice, which can be practiced in a chair. No previous meditation experience is necessary.

The Isha Kriya process was developed by realized yogi, Sadhguru Vasudev. Sadhguru is renowned for his powerful yoga and meditation programs, as well as thriving humanitarian initiatives. He has been hosted to speak and offer meditations at numerous global leadership forums, businesses and universities, including the United Nations, the World Economic Forum, the British House of Lords, TED, MIT, and the World Peace Congress.

This free session will be facilitated by a trained Isha Kriya instructor. Contact: [masked],[masked] for more information about Isha USA or this session.

For more on Sadhguru and Isha, visit IshaUSA.org/blog

results.description:
LIVE STREAM FROM SILICON VALLEY.


We are looking for s sponsor for the livestream, and if anyone is interested, please shoot me a message. The stream is broadcast to startup entrepreneurs (Access Silicon Valley members) in San Diego, Los Angeles, New York, Boston, Chicago, Seattle, Austin,  Boulder/Denver, Toronto and Mexico City, and the sponsor will have their logo prominently displayed on the video during the entire event (and on the video wherever it may be posted) and a shout out at the event before it starts.


IN ORDER TO VIEW THIS EVENT, YOU MUST RSVP. WE WILL SEND YOU A LINK TO THE EVENT ON THE DAY OF THE EVENT. 

Please join us on November 10, 2015 for the next Access Silicon Valley event, featuring Duncan Davidson, a serial entrepreneur and Managing Partner of Bullpen Capital, the leading post-seed venture firm in Silicon Valley (investors in Fanduel, Ipsy, Tanium, Marketo, Zynga, Desk.com, Classy, Life360 and many more).

In this interactive, audience led discussion, Duncan, will discuss:

-- the "perceived" bubble in venture funding;

-- Is there a bubble?  If so...who is likely to be most affected?


-- is seed funding drying up?


-- how can you prepare for a funding environment after the bubble does burst? 

If you are an entrepreneur or founder of a startup, you don't want to miss this interactive, audience led discussion with Duncan.  Get an insight into the seed venture ecosystem. Hear about Duncan's view of the funding environment today and how to prepare for 2016 and beyond!!


AGENDA:

6:40 PM – 7:00 PM CALIFORNIA TIME – pitches to Duncan

7:00 PM – 8:30 PM – Discussion with Duncan 



Duncan Davidson is a serial entrepreneur who most notably founded Covad Communications (the leading independent DSL provider, went public and reached a market value of $9B) and Sky Pilot Networks (developer of outdoor wireless mesh systems, acquired by Trillium in 2009 for connectivity to smart meters).

Prior to Bullpen, he co-founded one of the first mobile social app companies, Xumii, later sold to Myriad Group and now powering over 20M users in the developing world. At Bullpen he focuses on mobile and consumer Internet investments, and sits on the boards of DoubleDutch, SendHub, and Proformative. Key investments include Byliner, PaidPiper and Twenty20. He received a Sc.B. in physics/math from Brown University, with Honors, and a J.D. magna cum laude from Michigan Law School, where he was Order of the Coif and a member of the Law Review.

Bullpen Capital is the leader in post-seed, pre Series A funding of companies that have achieved market fit and that have an operational plan to hit big milestones within 12 months. Some of Bullpen's current and former portfolio companies include: 



EVENT ORGANIZER:



PREMIER SPONSORS:

Procopio - Ranked among the 2014 and 2015 Best Law Firms by U.S. News & World Report

Award winning marketing educator Christina Inge will share 7 Tips to grow your impact for raising visibility with SEO, Social Media, Mobile and E Mail

Register Here

Cost: $10 General Admission, FREE to Impact Hub, CIC, and Seeking Work

Meet me at the entrance at 9:30, or look for Sam and I on the upstairs level.


Admission: $12.00

Hope to see you there!

You and your child will participate in innovative, fun-filled obstacle courses that teach the basic gymnastics elements - swinging, climbing, running, jumping, and other motor development activities. Feel free to have a snack after in one of our party rooms as long as you clean up! $10/child $15/family. $8/child currently enrolled in a class at Exxcel $12/family currently enrolled in a class at Exxcel Spaces are limited RSVP soon! Want to learn from an entrepreneur who has scaled to over 8 million active users, and raised money from Silicon Valley's top investors? Then join us on this FREE "How To Get the First Customers for Your Startup" webinar. 

On this webinar, we will outline successful strategies to acquire the first set of users for your startup idea. In addition, we’ll teach you how to learn from your customers and keep them interested in your product - without writing any code! 

This webinar will feature two successful serial entrepreneurs: 

- Gagan Biyani, Co-Founder and CEO of Sprig (one of Silicon Valley's fastest growing startups), Co-Founder of Udemy (the world's largest source of online courses), and former Growth Advisor for Lyft. 

- Adeo Ressi (Founder and CEO of the Founder Institute, 9X entrepreneur, and Managing Director of Expansive Ventures). 

You’ll learn: 
- How to start generating customers before writing any code 
- How to perform customer development 
- How to learn from your customers and keep them interested in your product We hope you will join us!

---

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Wednesday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Do you VEGETABLE-TARIANS want all the OTHER people (even if they have not committed to be vegetarians) to eat fresh produce?  Then help us - each Wednesday late afternoon - bag vegetables (and some fruit) for the neighbors in Mission Hill.  Usually there are also freshly-baked loaves of bread, also (baked that morning - Jessica's Bakery).

It's an assembly line, then take home a bag (or two) of produce for yourself. 

Bring your business cards, smartphone, or notepad, and prepare to exchange contact info with other volunteers you like.  Volunteers come from several sources (not merely this meetup or others:Craigslist, Pharmacy School, School of Public Health, etc.) 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
VOLUNTEERING for $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill
Tobin Community Center
1481 Tremont Street - inside the front entrance
Mission Hill, Roxbury
(between Brigham Circle and Roxbury Crossing T stops)
Boston, MA 02120 - <2 blocks from Orange Line T Each Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm (indoors in bad weather)


We will be VOLUNTEERING for the weekly Wednesday late afternoon $2/bag of produce in Mission Hill.

When you volunteer,
YOU will ALSO TAKE HOME one or two of those "$2 bags"! 
We've had 55 volunteers, and we've had 7.  Workloads vary!

Fair Foods provides a 20-22 bag of produce for the Mission Hill neighbors so they can eat like me - on produce. The neighbors only need to pay' $2 for the bag.

Volunteers unload the truck, set up 3 banquet tables, set up the food in order of desntiy (heavy food, such as potatoes or onions, on the bottom - lighter, more perishable foods, such as tomatoes and bananas and berries and kale on top), then fill each bag (and 'stack' them upright by one another - for the 'paying neighbors' to pick up (for $2).

Some arrive as early as 3:30 pm (you don't NEED to do that, but you're welcome to do so; OUR meetup's attendees - it's posted on 6 meetups - are often there early, and you can chat).

We (MOST of us) arrive around 4 pm (maybe as late as 4:30 pm) and work until 6 pm (can leave as early as 5:30 pm if we've finished).

In the FRONT of the Tobin Community Center, 1481 Tremont Street (between the Brigham Circle T stop - GREEN E-Line - and the Roxbury Crossing Orange Line T stop), behind the wrought iron fence.

Wear comfortable clothing that allows you to move flexibly and to actually work, lifting heavy bags of food. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Tobin Community Center 
1481 Tremont Street, Boston, MA

THERE IS NO PARKING - IT'S BEST FOR THOSE WHO LIVE IN BOSTON AND TRAVEL IN ON THE MBTA

THERE IS NO PARKING IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD

Every Wednesday, from 4:00 - 6:00 pm 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Bring friends!  Forward the invitation to others!

Invite FRIENDS through the Facebook, LinkedIn, and Twitter 'share' 
buttons
http://www.yelp.com/events/boston-volunteering-for-2-bag-of-produce-in-mission-hill-each-wednesday-afternoon-from-4-6-pm-at-tobin-community-center

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort.
TALK with us FIRST !!

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!! 

Looking for an ARTIST to help VISUALLY REPRESENT this vegetable outreach effort. 


TALK with us FIRST !! 

Looking for Gifted Marketers to 
(i) conceptualize the WHY of low cost vegetable distribution! and 
(ii) the desirability of TAKING the low cost vegetables !!

LOGISTICAL CHALLENGE IS TO GET LOW COST VEGETABLES to the REFRIGERATORS of LOCAL RESIDENTS !!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
Vegan Cooking classes or Vegan Cooking Ideas 

Vegan Cooking Classes or 
                 Learning How to Prepare Vegan Food 
                    (using the $2 bag of produce as a low-cost start) 

* What Can You Do With Your $2 Bag?
* Portion Control
* Bake...Don't Fry!
* Roasted Veggie Stackers
* No-Guilt Banana Ice Cream
* Avocados!!!
* Salad with Chipotle Hummus
* Simple Cilantro Chutney
* More $2 bags of Produce!
* Drink your greens!

results.description:
Our usual schedule is 


• 5:30-6pm Welcome everyone and discuss progress  on goals from last week. Order drinks and appetizers or dinner. 


• 6-7:00pm Focused discussion and work on our topic for the week. In addition to discussion of the theory, we really want to do exercises and make progress on real problems.


• 7-7:30pm Conclude and set individual goals for next meeting 


• 7:30-... Chat, mingle and leave whenever

Please bring something to write with and on.
results.how_to_find_us: We are you in the back right. It should be easy to find.
results.name: Wednesday Workshop: Goal Factoring

results.description:
We are cooking up an amazing event for our November meetup. The Angular core team will be helping us to run a short training session in Angular 2 basics followed by an Angular 2 Hackathon which will include some awesome prizes. 

------------------

Note: Unfortunately, we can no longer welcome recruiters and hiring professionals to the meetups. 

------------------ 


Schedule:

5pm - Early arrival for anyone helping to set up the room or if you can be an instruction assistant

5:30pm - Doors open for everyone; beer and pizza available

6pm to 7pm - Angular 2 training

7pm to 9pm - Hackathon

9pm to 10pm - Finishing up and judging (over $500 in prizes and giveaways)

------------------

While the Cengage website lists 20 Channel Center Street, please use the 10 Channel Center Street entrance.

Address: 10 Channel Center Street - 3rd Floor South Boston, MA 02210

Google Maps:  https://www.google.com/maps/place/10+Channel+Center+St/@42.345056,-71.0519167,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89e37a7dc3c3589d:0x11ddd2541614f619

Public Transit: Broadway Station (Redline). From Broadway Station, Head southeast on W Broadway toward A St for 120 yards Go North (take a left) onto A Street for .3 miles We have entrances to the building on A Street and on Channel Center Street.

From South Station (Commuter Rail and Redline) Take the white Channel Center shuttle from in front of the Federal Reserve Bank OrTake Summer Street over the channel for .3 miles Turn right on Melchor Street for .1 miles Turn right on A Street for .3 miles We have entrances to the building on A Street and on Channel Center Street.

Parking: http://en.parkopedia.com/parking/20_channel_center_street_boston_ma/ Watch out for the meters, most of them switch to "Resident Only" parking at 6pm.
results.name: Angular 2 Training and Hackathon

results.description:
NOTE: RSVP'ing here does NOT get you a meal!

Call Tomko, before 10 a.m., on the Wed. you are interested to go. [masked]

>>>

For me on my journey of self-awareness and personal growth, learning what foods work for me and which foods don't has been an important part.


I attend this weekly meal every Wednesday! Eating Tomoko's food helps me in my week. I always look forward to Wednesday, knowing I will have a principled, tasty, and lovingly cooked meal at the end of my day!

Letting you all know about this weekly resource, and reminding those of you who already know.

--Paul G.

Tomoko Shibuya is an excellent vegan cook, trained in macrobiotic principles. I thought I'd remind you all that she makes a meal for the public every Wednesday.

The food is both healthful and delicious. You can eat in or take out. The cooking is superb, the ingredients carefully selected and organic, and when you come in you may find two people eating, or 12!

More details below, from Ms. Shibuya:

Menu 11/11/2015
*Ingredients will be changed sometimes.
*I use organic ingredients as much as possible (90%~100%).
*In the menu, SALT is Atlantic sea salt, OIL will be Light sesame oil, roasted sesame oil, sunflower oil or safflower oil. Soup /Nappa Cabbage, Celery, Italian Parsley, Maine Kombu Broth, Dulse, Salt, Tamari


Grain / Brown Rice, Watermelon Radish, Hemp Heart, Salt


Pickles / Cabbage, Scallion, Sesame Seeds, Salt, Roasted Sesame Seed


Greens / Chard, Fennel, Salt, Oil Side 1 / Rice Elbow Pasta, Northern White Bean, Carrot, in Butternut and Cashew Nut Butter Cream, Salt Oil Side 2 / Daikon, Onion, Zucchini, Seitan (request tofu for GF), Red Miso, Rice Syrup, Oil

VEGAN MACROBIOTIC MEAL
Cooked by Tomoko Shibuya

Macrobiotic practitioner
and healer since 1987.
(Kushi Institute International certified
Macrobiotic cooking instructor and Guide.)
Nationally licensed cook in Japan
since 1989.


More meal photos, see below of this email or click
Wednesday Dinner Photos http://www.facebook.com/album.php?aid=185893&id=612670780
History photos of Tomoko's meals and sweets in USA

http://www.facebook.com/album.php?id=612670780&aid=337184


I receive your calls and make a name list for the dinner.
Do quick meditation to make everything easier.
Face to ingredients and start to prepare it with thinking about you. Before I cover a pot with grain, I add REIKI / universal energy in it, for having more emotional peace, physical health and wealth.


My cooking attitude is exactly same as how I have cooked for my kids. Always love comes first. Then what comes second? The joy. Every Wednesday Eat meal here or pick up to go
5:30 – 8:00 PM Wednesdays
8 PM is the last serving.
You are welcome to stay longer.


10 Belknap St, Arlington, MA 02474
(781)[masked] * Please note: No orders can be accepted after 10 AM,
as I am busy cooking and cannot pick up the phone. *

results.description:
Hello ASL Enthusiasts!

A number of folks living NORTH of Boston have asked about an ASL SOCIAL. Let's make this happen!

On WEDNESDAYS, starting October 29 - 6pm to 8pm - I / we will be at the NORTH SHORE MALL Food Court.

While technology has improved the way people communicate, "Deaf Social Clubs" are slowly disappearing. This is a way to start bringing REAL social interaction back!

Please join us for a casual, relaxed, no-pressure two-hour Social, where we can chat, tell stories, get to know each other, and meet new people (or old friends!). Friends, Fun and Food!

A warm welcome is extended to all Deaf & non-Deaf people: folks in the Deaf Community, CODA's, Interpreters, ASL students, parents of deaf children AND their children, ASL professors/teachers, Relay Operators, Deaf services workers- EVERYONE!

This will be a "SOME ASL KNOWLEDGE and ABOVE" Social, because not all of us are ASL-fluent! "Voices- Off" -- we'll all laugh & learn WITH and FROM each other!

WHAT: ASL SOCIAL CLUB
WHERE: North Shore Mall Food Court, PEABODY,MA
DAY/TIME: Wednesdays, 6pm - 8pm
WHY: To meet like-minded people, socialize using ASL, tell stories, and have good time!
WHO: Anyone who wants to chat using American Sign Language!
HOW TO FIND US:  We'll be sitting on the couches closest to the "walkway" side of the Food Court, not hidden inside the food court, so easier to locate us!

If you have any question, please contact Connie or Paul I., through the EMAIL LINK via BOSTON ASL profile page.

PLEASE, if you would be good enough, RSVP either "YES" or "NO" so I know who to look for!

CHEERS!

Connie Cassidy / Paul I.

PEACE...
results.why: ASL is the third largest "foreign language" in the U.S.; ASL is fun to use; ASL is NOT English, but does "borrow" from the English language.
results.how_to_find_us: The folks talking with their hands!
results.name: Weekly North Shore ASL Social!

Please RSVP for this game so we know we have enough people. We'll confirm by 3pm or earlier that the game is on.

6:30-6:45 pm - Warm up & practice, we'll work on some throws, passes & catches.

6:45 pm - Game starts.

General guidelines: Dress accordingly. Bring a white & dark shirt so we can easily divide into 2 teams. Have plenty of water. Sunscreen on a sunny day. Stretch & warm up. We'll provide discs and cones.

Weather: Rain in New England is unpredictable. We will send out a final notice one hour before start time if cancellation is necessary.

RSVP: Very helpful as this is how we contact you in case of game changes & cancellations.

About: Playing Ultimate is all about good sportsmanship, respect, and gracefulness on the field.  Fun & having a good time is a must above anything else. It's an easy game to pick up & we keep the rules minimal. No zones, no stall count, no scores, and players self-officiate on the field.  Open to all levels of players.  Beginners welcome.

Warning: Excessive fun & comradery developed from playing Ultimate may become addicting.

results.description:
$20 to attend. Please be on time and sign up only if you're positive you can be present.


In this workshop we'll read your work and give you constructive suggestions to strengthen it. From larger structural and character considerations to minor formatting and story bumps, we'll help you make your script tighter, evocative, and more compelling. 


Please bring at least four copies of ONE of the following:

1. Ten pages of an original feature screenplay (or a ten or less-page short film) that you wrote yourself.
2. A treatment that you wrote yourself (one to two-page synopsis of the plot) for a proposed original screenplay. Please keep treatments to two pages maximum.


If you haven't written a script or treatment, then come with your questions and a willingness to provide constructive feedback for others.


Regardless of what you bring, be sure to PRINT OUT COPIES so that we can read it together. If you don't print them out, we'll have no way to workshop your work! At least four would be appreciated.

If you haven't written a screenplay or treatment but are curious about the process, then we definitely have a place for you. For beginners, we highly recommend grabbing a copy of The Complete Screenwriter's Manual (http://www.amazon.com/Complete-Screenwriters-Manual-Comprehensive-Reference/dp/0321397932) and screenwriting software (free: CeltX.com, more features: FinalDraft.com)

For more personalized script attention, I offer one-on-one screenplay coverage services. Details and testimonials: http://www.screenplay.guru. 10% off for Cambridge Screenwriting members.

We can't wait to see you!
results.name: Group Screenplay Workshop - $20

results.description:
Security Tactics for Functional Testing 

Speaker:              Margaret Shinkle 

Meeting Date:Wednesday November 11, 2015

Meeting Time:    Networking and Pizza: 6-6:30pm                                                                                     

                               Discussion 6:30-8pm

Location:    Oracle-Sun Campus            

                    45 Network Drive Northwest Park Burlington MA 01803

Cost:          Free! 

Abstract:   

Adding the word "security" to any testing is often daunting.  Testers who are not specifically testing for security in a feature often feel that it is best left to "security experts".  However, testing for security can be added to basic functional testing.  This presentation covers some basic tools to identify risk areas and what to look for when thinking about "security" when planning functional tests.

Speaker Bio: 

Margaret Shinkle is a Systems Quality Tester for the SUN division of Oracle, verifying security-related features of new systems hardware.  She has worked in QE for 15 years.  In a previous life, she worked in IT, with shared responsibilities in network, lab management, test engineering, and customer training.  Marge is familiar to all as one of our gracious Sun-Oracle hosts and an SQGNE Director.
results.how_to_find_us: Rte I-95/128 to Exit 32 Middlesex Turnpike - pass Burlington Mall. Oracle-Sun Campus is about 2 miles down on left.

results.description:
Boston Traders' Meetup

You are invited to attend the monthly Boston Traders' Meetup meetings.

The format for the monthly meetings is that each person will introduce her- or himself and state the market that he or she trades and perhaps a very brief description of the approach taken. For example, an introduction could be, "Hi, my name is Fred Hampton and I trade forex breakouts during the London session."

From there, the floor is open for people to discuss anything about trading. You may talk about something you learned recently about trading or about an obstacle that you are facing in trading or make a request for resources from other members.

Please print out and bring this BostonTradersMeetup sign so you can connect with the other members easily.
www.meetup.com/BostonTraders/files/

Part of the purpose of this group is for people to connect with other traders so it's encouraged for people to exchange contact info. For example, if you are an options trader and another options trader talks about a topic that interests you, then feel free to ask the person if she or he would like to exchange contact info.

--------------------


This meeting is located in the Starbucks inside what is called the "Boston Marriott" even though the hotel is located in Kendall Square, Cambridge. The Kendall Square subway stop is a Red Line stop at "Kendall."

This meeting is FREE and it repeats on the 2nd Wednesday of every month.

results.description:
IT'S COMING!!!


PHP7 is(tentatively) scheduled for release on November 12, 2015, and everyone wants to know what will be changing and how to prepare.  We are excited to welcome Cal Evans to Boston to give us the details.

Talk Description

Upgrades are scary. Many of us remember moving to PHP 5.3 and all that it entailed. Some of us remember moving to PHP 5.0 and the headaches it caused. Now we are all faced with PHP7 and some of us are starting to sweat.

Fear not. While PHP7 is a major upgrade to the engine, the big changes are new features for developers to use.  There are very few BC breaks.

Cal will walk us through the 5 things that will make the biggest difference to developers. This talk will get you started down the road of preparing your code for PHP7.

Agenda

6:00 PM - 7:00 PM: Free pizza

7:00 PM - 7:15 PM:  Announcements

7:15 PM - 8:45 PM:  PHP7: the Big 5 + 1 with Cal Evans

9:00 PM - ???: Drinks and conversation at meadhall in Kendall Square

Note: changing from Champions to meadhall based on recent interest.  As a community-based group we welcome your suggestions if you would prefer something else!


About Cal

Cal Evans might just be the epitome of what makes the PHP Community a great community.  He has been programming since the age of 14 and working with PHP for over eight years.  He is currently a Technical Manager, Training and Certification at Zend Technologies.  In addition to being a well known speaker, he helps make the PHP community special in many ways, including:

• Blogger and author of 4+ books about PHP and Software Development


• Host of the Voices of the ElePHPant Podcast


• Founder and organizer of Nomad PHP, a virtual PHP user group

• Creator of the Wisdom of the ElePHPant website (and booklets)

Sponsor


We are incredibly thankful for Zend Training for sponsoring this month's event.  Zend provides training for all levels, including PHP and Zend Framework Certifications.  If you're in the market for some training, definitely check them out!

Enter to win a PHP7 ElePHPant!


Zend Training will be giving away a free PHP7 ElePHPant at the event.  Thank them for making this event possible by going here to register for a chance to win:

http://devzone.zend.com/go/win-a-free-php-7-elephpant/


You must be present at the event to win.


Virtual Self-study


See PHP Percolate, Season 8 for details on how you can learn these new features with fellow BostonPHP members at your own pace.
results.name: PHP7: the Big 5 + 1

results.description:
T4 template support was added in the March 2014 release of SQL Server Data Tools (SSDT). You can now create T4 templates to automatically create CRUD procedures for all the tables in your database project, views as an abstraction layer, and auditing triggers. ORM tools such as EF and nHibernate can handle CRUD operations in code, but if you want to provide an API to your database and avoid the tedious work of manually creating simple CRUD procedures, views, and audit triggers, this is the session for you!

Jack Corbett (@unclebiguns)began working with SQL Server, Access, and VB in 1999, when he served an apprenticeship with a good friend who was the software development manager at the local paper mill. He found his niche and has concentrated on SQL Server development and administration since late 2000. He has worked with SQL Server through version 2012 and has been a Microsoft MVP for SQL Server since October 2011. Jack has presented at many user groups, SQLSaturdays and the 2015 PASS Summit.

Before our main speaker, Maisy Wong will be presenting a lightning talk.
results.name: Tired of the Crud? Automate It!  T4 templates in SSDT - Jack Corbett

Come join us for a midweek climb!


All levels are welcome! If you are new to climbing, there is a belay class at 7 PM. Here is the link to sign up: www.centralrockgym.com/bookeo.php?s=watertown 

I will happily belay those who have not climbed before up until 7 PM, but then it's really important to know how to belay and to take the belay test that starts at 7 PM. You can rejoin the group after taking the belay test.

For those of you who already know how to belay, no need to take the class, you just need to pass this gym's belay test when you arrive.

The price is as follows:

Membership: $89/month

Adult Day Pass: $22 

Gear (shoes, harness, belay device): $8 ($5 for members)

Belay class: $15 (free for members)

Belay test: Free

We will meet at the cluster of cubbies on the first floor at 6:30 PM, greet each other, make sure everyone has a group or person to climb with then head off to climb. I'm looking into whether there is a place nearby to grab a bite or drink at the end of the night. If you have a place in mind, please let me know.

I'll send a message letting you know what color shirt and pants I am wearing incase you arrive late and want to search for us. I will also swing by the cubbies every 15 minutes until everyone who signed up has arrived. So, if you are not able to make it or are running late, PLEASE COMMUNICATE on this event's chat or by contacting my cell-phone, which I will send out once you are confirmed for the event.

Hope you can make it! I'm looking forward to meeting more climbers in the area.

~Avery~

Come join David and friends for a night of Magic: The Gathering over at Not Your Average Joe's in Medford. This event is part of our "Wednesday Night Magic" series.

It doesn't matter if you are an expert "planeswalker", or don't know anything about Magic: The Gathering -- you can come to play or learn this amazing strategy game.  There are usually between 6-12 people at each event, consisting of all experience levels.  All decks of all types are welcome for this "casual play" event.  Beginners who want to learn are welcome!

This location is easily accessible from Rt. 16, Rt. 28 and Rt. 93, and is walking distance from the T, near the new Station Landing apartment complex. Here is a map of the area.

By Subway: Take the Orange Line to Wellington. Walk over the skybridge and cross through the parking lot. Upon exiting the garage, you'll see a building complex (SL75) across the street. Cross the street and take a right. Follow around this building and you'll find Not Your Average Joe's on the opposite side of the street.

By Car: If you are driving, be aware that Station Landing is at the intersection of Rt. 16 and Rt. 28, and you can enter the Station Landing complex from the north-bound side of Rt. 28, or the east-bound side of Rt. 16. There are a number of stores in the Station Landing complex -- look for the Margarita's, Starbucks or Not Your Average Joe's signs. NYAJ is located right off of Rte. 28. Although there is free parking all around the building, we recommend that MTG Boston members park in the garage underneath the restaurant.

results.description:
Headaches are all too common, and can be frustrating to deal with. Conventional wisdom would have it that over-the-counter drugs are the easy answer, but there are grave risks associated with the use of common painkillers, especially as a habit of frequent use. Fundamentally, though, this one-size-fits-all approach is flawed: there are many kinds of headaches – tension, migraine, cluster, pre-menstrual, etc – and each requires a different strategy.

In this class, we will discuss which types of headache respond best to which herbs. Focusing on nervous, digestive, blood-building, and adaptogenic herbs, as well as lifestyle factors, we will get to the root of headache pain to reduce both quantity and frequency.

Please note: This is a ticketed event. It is NOT enough to RSVP to this meetup page. Tickets can be purchased here:

Free tickets are available to Humanist Hub Sustaining and Growth Members. Please email [masked] for your free ticket.
----------------------------
Some twenty-five centuries after the Buddha started teaching, his message continues to inspire people across the globe, including those living in predominantly secular societies. What does it mean to adapt religious practices to secular contexts? Stephen Batchelor, an internationally known author and teacher, is committed to a secularized version of the Buddha’s teachings. The time has come, he feels, to articulate a coherent ethical, contemplative, and philosophical vision of Buddhism for our age. "After Buddhism," the culmination of four decades of study and practice in the Tibetan, Zen, and Theravada traditions, is his attempt to set the record straight about who the Buddha was and what he was trying to teach. Combining critical readings of the earliest canonical texts with narrative accounts of five members of the Buddha’s inner circle, Batchelor depicts the Buddha as a pragmatic ethicist rather than a dogmatic metaphysician. He envisions Buddhism as a constantly evolving culture of awakening whose long survival is due to its capacity to reinvent itself and interact creatively with each society it encounters. This original and provocative book presents a new framework for understanding the remarkable spread of Buddhism in today’s globalized world. It also reminds us of what was so startling about the Buddha’s vision of human flourishing. Join Stephen Batchelor for the Cambridge, Mass. stop on the book tour for his book: After Buddhism: Rethinking the Dharma for a Secular Age. Books will be available for purchase.
results.name: Stephen Batchelor: After Buddhism: Rethinking the Dharma for a Secular Age

results.description:
Welcome to the weekly BKBS Wednesday meet up. Please join us at 7:00 PM by the 3rd table station in the middle of the top roping / lead area. If you are still by the bouldering wall, keep on walking.

We usually meet there for about 10 mins, and then team up in groups of 2 or 3 for top-rope climbing.

If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

BKBS (http://www.bkbsomerville.com/Classes/. If you have a working knowledge of how to belay, you will need to be belay certified before climbing on the ropes. Please flag down a BKBS employee and let them know you need to take a belay test. To pass such a test you will need to display how to tie a double figure eight knot with a fisherman's backup, safely belay a climber up a wall, catch them on a fall, and lower them to the ground safely.

What equipment do I need?  You will need at the bare minimum a harness and climbing shoes. Rentals are available. Grigri devices are provided at every station.

What if I can come, but at a different time?  Just let everyone know you want to climb at a different time and use the community to find a partner for those dates / times.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.how_to_find_us: The third table in the middle of the climbing area between 7:00-7:10 PM. It's the table in the middle of the TR \/ Lead area.

PLEASE NOTE: In anticipation of the Glass-Chewing Leader of the Cartel's imminent absence due to Family Growth, hosting duties for the regular Wednesday Night Gaming is being handled by a rotating cast of regulars.

Wednesday Night Gaming is our more-or-less weekly free-for-all of strategy gaming goodness downstairs at the Porter Square Panera. There's rarely a set agenda for these events but you are welcome and encouraged to hash out a plan beforehand in comments if you've got something you're dying to play. Nonetheless, you are not required to bring a game to play -- our only requirement is that you bring an open mind!

The event officially begins at 7 PM but people often trickle in early, so you're welcome to sit down to a filler game to get warmed up, or arrange to meet a little early if you've got a group looking to tackle an extra-meaty game.

Please be aware that Panera has been quite gracious about hosting us with minimal fuss -- in order to keep things this way, please respect the hardworking people who work there and, especially, their desire to get out after a long shift.

We'll see you at the gaming table!

NOTE:  Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-day-boston-tickets-18141385372

The functionality and purpose of Big Data is obvious in regards to the world of news, advertising, transportation, and research. Yet, one of the biggest owners of data, Google, is also one of the biggest companies in the world of robotics. In the past few years alone Google has purchased over 60 drone companies. Something where the Google algorithm for robots is similar to an integrated intelligence system like the movie Terminator proposed in 1984 with Skynet.

Yet, big data is now keeping people in an isolated world with things like personalized news feeds and everything being customized according to a person's internet and phone activity. This is a discussion to debate is big data good for humanity?

Location is pending.  Please RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/big-data-day-tickets-17999656457
results.name: Big Data Discussion On Its Impact on AI and Humanity

results.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE: This event is being hosted by Somerville Climate Action and Tiny House Northeast. Attendance is limited and you must RSVP at the link below to guarantee entry. RSVPing to the Meetup event alone is *not* sufficient.

RSVP here: http://scatinyhouseevent.brownpapertickets.com/

SECOND NOTE: The talk is mostly geared towards people just getting into the movement, and probably won't be as appealing to those who have been doing a lot of their own learning already. Still, it's a good opportunity to meet other folks!

Join Somerville Climate Action, tiny house enthusiasts, and those who want to live smaller (and happier!) on Wednesday, November 11th for an evening tiny house presentation by Tiny House Northeast.

The more sustainable "tiny house" approach to home ownership presented to us through mostly commercial media has set a segment of American culture on fire! We love the idea of a more affordable, greener housing option. Tiny House Northeast's project manager/lead designer, Isa Bauer C., will offer a view into the real world advantages and challenges of a tiny home. It's a lot more complicated than the TV shows make it appear! The presentation will help you learn whether this lifestyle is for you, and if it is, what ducks you need to get in order to help make your tiny house journey a success. An area will also be marked off in the size of a tiny house floor plan, so you can get a sense of the space you are working with, how to add "components", etc.

SUGGESTED DONATION: $5 (accepted at the presentation)

Food and beverage will be available for purchase throughout the evening. Cash and credit cards accepted.
results.name: Tiny House Presentation with Tiny House Northeast

results.description:
Awaken the Healing Power within Your Body and Mind


·  Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing power

·  Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships

·  Learn to work constructively with your own emotions

·  Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities

·  Develop new resources and capabilities

·  Become clear about your life’s purpose

Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us.

Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs.

Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses

Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life.

Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you.

Discover the passion and power that resides within you

Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind

We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies.

Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.

Alternate Tuesdays at 7:30 PM at Unity of Somerville, located at 6 William Street at the corner of College Avenue

Call (913)[masked] to learn more

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information
results.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body and Mind

results.description:
Please RSVP! (E51-335  - 70 Memorial Dr. Cambridge, MA - map, parking info at bottom of announcement.

Navigating a Tricky Market, Market Outlook Talk

By Stanley Dash, VP, Applied Technical Analysis, Trade Station

Stanley Dash will review current market conditions from a technical analysis perspective.

• US stocks -- market internals, divergences and long-term valuation

• Sector rotation – where are we now?

• Interest rates – cycles in Treasury yields, and key levels to watch

• Gold – technical conditions and futures Commitments of Traders data

• Intermarket correlations – what do they say about the markets and the economy?

• Ideas and techniques for traders

Stanley Dash is Vice-president, Applied Technical Analysis, at TradeStation, where he heads the TradeStation Labs initiative.  He and his group support active and institutional traders with analytical tools and education designed to help them be more effective traders.

Mr. Dash began his career on Wall Street with E. F. Hutton & Co. in 1975.  His experience includes institutional and retail trading, management, and compliance.  Mr. Dash was also an active floor trader at one of the leading U.S. futures and options exchanges.  He began consulting for TradeStation in 1997m, and he has worked there full-time since 2003.  .

Mr. Dash has long spoken and trained for such noteworthy organizations as the New York Institute of Finance and the Institute for Financial Markets.  He has written and lectured on topics including stocks, futures, options and technical analysis.

Mr. Dash is a frequent resource for the press and has been quoted by Investor’s Business Daily, USA Today, TheStreet.com, Reuters, and the BBC, and has appeared on FoxNews.com Live and Fox News Radio Network.

Mr. Dash is currently registered as an associated person (futures) and general securities principal.  Mr. Dash is a member of the Market Technicians Association, a Chartered Market Technician and serves on the Editorial Board of the Association’s Journal of Technical Analysis and on the Ethics and Standards Committee.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

MIT Building E51 (The Tang Center) is located at 70 Memorial Drive, but the entrance is at 2 Amherst Street.  You can park behind the building, or one block West off Hayward Street.

Here is a map link: http://whereis.mit.edu/?go=E51

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you! Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room. We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone. This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.

What if we read the books we love as if they were sacred texts?What would we learn? How might we change?
Join us as we (re)read all seven Harry Potter books and explore what they might teach us about our own lives. Between now and April, each week we’ll read a handful of chapters in our own time and then gather on Wednesday evening to talk through the passages that struck us the most.

Bring: A copy of Harry Potter (we’ll announce which one)
