results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

I'm working out in the field much of the time. I have very limited access to the internet and that can make it difficult for me to respond to emails. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

results.description:
This event takes place in the lovely vibes of the Mun Su Sah Dharma Hall. Buddha will be there! Suggested donation $20.

Recently I've been able to accomplish everything I've set my heart to. I want to share that energy on a special day with old and new friends alike! Where there is love and light, synchroncities -those 'chance' encounters that put you on your path - are bound to happen. 11:11 signifies spiritual awakening, as this number seems to be predominantly noticed by those who have begun their spiritual journeys. Some might say this is illogical but if you've started to pick up on the signs and numbers in your life and what they are pointing to, you'll understand the signficance of the energy and intention behind this date.


We are all petals on the unfolding flower of life and its all the more beautful when we blossom together.

So if you come to the Buddhist Temple, what can you expect?

When you come in, you take your shoes off, then you walk to the Dharma Hall which will be on your immediate right at the top of the stairs. We'll start with a short introduction and discuss each of our intentions for how we want to work with the sound and then meditate for a few minutes to tune into each of our specific intentions. The general theme will be answering the wake-up call to the divine presence ... And trust me, if you come, you will hear it ringing ; )

Then, everyone will sit or lie down on super comfy pillow mats (bring your own blanket/blindfold) and we'll begin our journey into sound.

I start by playing the 500 pound cast-iron temple bell and then I move into the sweet sounds of my Tibetan singing bowls. The three I use to entrain the brain to meditation allow the body to enter deep relaxation so that the body, mind and spirit are capable of opening to the really deep work that needs be done!

What follows, I can't exactly say, as the sound decides what it wants to say. But you can expect to hear the rainbow voice, the sound of the overtone chant singing with the tibetan bowls. You

won't be able to tell which is which but this is all part of the dance. You will even feel what it's like to have the bowls played on you as the sound moves your energy where it needs to go. Tingshas, tuning forks, rattles and other otherworldly sounds are all part of the play as the sound moves you to rest at your destination without ever having moved. 

So, please, come and feel something unique. You never leave anywhere exactly the same, but when it comes to sound healing, you will leave sounding more like yourself :)

results.description:
Headaches are all too common, and can be frustrating to deal with. Conventional wisdom would have it that over-the-counter drugs are the easy answer, but there are grave risks associated with the use of common painkillers, especially as a habit of frequent use. Tylenol isn't Paleo! Fundamentally, though, this one-size-fits-all approach is flawed: there are many kinds of headaches – tension, migraine, cluster, pre-menstrual, etc – and each requires a different strategy.

In this class, we will discuss which types of headache respond best to which herbs. Focusing on nervous, digestive, blood-building, and adaptogenic herbs, as well as lifestyle factors, we will get to the root of headache pain to reduce both quantity and frequency.

Wednesday, November 11th, 2015
7:00pm – 9:00pm
25 St. Mary’s Court, Brookline

The fee for this class is $20.

results.description:
What do you really want for your life?  

To be successful in life, to live life fully, we must uncover our true answer to that -- what is in our heart, and not necessarily what we have been taught to believe.  

We will each share what we want, and, perhaps more importantly, why those things mean so much to us.  And then we'll go deeper!  We'll reprise two exercises from Insight, and we'll augment a few exercises and insights from other sources.


And we'll discuss "Be-Do-Have". 


The things that we want "to have":  
- cars, boats, planes, partners.

The things that we want "to do":
- sky dive, travel, own business, wedding. 

And the things that we want "to be":
- peaceful, loving, joyous.

We will get a better idea of what we really want in our life.

About the Insight Practice Group
Insight Practice Groups are open to everyone -- to Insight graduates and to non-graduates alike. The only requirement is that you come ready to examine what a better life for yourself might be, and willing to do something to create it.

The Insight Practice Group is an open, informal gathering of like-hearted people who would like to explore, share, practice, and extend some of the lessons that Insight (not uniquely, but powerfully) introduces in their seminars. We reprise exercises, apply them to our current life, examine how to better put our results into practice, and augment the lessons with other sources of wisdom.

Disclaimer: These sessions are led by untrained volunteers like you, some of whom have taken Insight and some of whom have not.  Insight Practice Groups are inspired by, but not associated with, Insight Seminars.
results.name: IPG-128S: What Do You Want?

results.description:
Everybody Hurts (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ijZRCIrTgQc).  People break bones, get cancer, get in accidents, etc... So what should we do when that happens?  How should a person's health and well-being be cared for?  Is it the responsibility of each individual to look after herself/himself?  Or is it all of our responsibility to keep everyone healthy?  How for can the idea of "Healthcare" be stretched?  I queried a couple of articles, one which proposes that Healthcare is a human right and the other that it is not.  Whether or not it's a right, should there be universal healthcare and how much should be covered?

It's a right:

http://www.forbes.com/sites/theapothecary/2013/03/28/yes-health-care-is-a-right-an-individual-right/

It's not a right:

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1126951/

Let's meetup and discuss!

results.name: Healthcare and Human Rights

results.description:
Join the Boston Austrian Economics Group as we embark upon Chapters 4 & 5, of Part 1, in the Austrian classic; "Human Action: A Treatise on Economics," by Ludwig von Mises. The group will discuss the weekly readings and questions.

Please note that the readings are not required to attend our meeting, but are recommended. As always, anyone interested in economics is welcome.

Tony C's Sports Bar and Grill has plenty of parking and is accessible via the Orange Line "Assembly" stop. READINGS:

Chapter 4: A FIRST ANALYSIS OF THE CATEGORY OF ACTION

Chapter 5: TIME

QUESTIONS:

1) What do we call the result sought by an action, and what does it relieve?

2) What are means, and how do you distinguish a thing from a means?

3) What is the distinction between "consumer goods" and "producer's goods?" Which goods are referred to as services?

4) How does the scale of value manifest itself, and what is the source of our knowledge concerning an actor's value scale?

5) All of economics is based upon which concept?

6) What is action, and how is exchange defined?

7) What happens when action doesn't attain the aim sought?

8) What makes man aware of the flux of time?

9) The "present" refers to a boundary line between the past and the future in philosophy and physics, but in the praxeological world, how is it defined?

10) What does time have in common with economics goods, and how does time differ from economic goods?

11) Which phenomenon can never occur simultaneously, and why?

12) What makes a potential action incapable of achieving its desired end?
results.name: ACTION ANALYSIS AND TIME

The functionality and purpose of Big Data is obvious in regards to the world of news, advertising, transportation, and research. Yet, one of the biggest owners of data, Google, is also one of the biggest companies in the world of robotics. In the past few years alone Google has purchased over 60 drone companies. Something where the Google algorithm for robots is similar to an integrated intelligence system like the movie Terminator proposed in 1984 with Skynet.

Yet, big data is now keeping people in an isolated world with things like personalized news feeds and everything being customized according to a person's internet and phone activity. This is a discussion to debate is big data good for humanity?

results.description:
Here are just some of the things you can get out of these meetings:

• Access to thousands of dollars of courses, software, and other resources

• Advice on overcoming a business or marketing obstacle you're facing

• Accountability

• Ideas and inspiration

• Meet awesome people who enjoy talking about this stuff as much as you do

Or, you can be a fly on the wall.  No pressure at all.  Feel free to drop in to just listen and see what internet marketing really looks like from people who are actually doing it.

We try to keep the meetings to about 60 - 90 minutes.  Here's the way it works:

• 7:00pm Join the meeting here:  https://hangouts.google.com/call/dq4qhhdefftaq3fmqwij2ipe2ea.  It tends to work best with Chrome (rather than Internet Explorer or FireFox).

• Intros, and goal checking:

• New Members:  What are you working on?  And what is it you hope to get out of attending these meetings?

• Existing Members:  How'd your week go?  Did you accomplish your goals?  What are your goals for next week.

• Check-Up on last week's Couch of Insight participate:  What results did he/she get from the session?

• The Couch of Insight:  One member goes into depth on what they've been working on, telling us where they need assistance, what resources have helped them to be successful, and what strategies have been valuable.

• (Meeting Ends around 8pm officially, but usually runs late with people wanting to help the person on The Couch.)

• Chat and Offer Assistance: The Hangout will remain open until everyone leaves.  You can stay as long as you want to meet new members and give the person on The Couch any advice or feedback you may have.

Feedback

What's ONE thing that would have made this meeting better? Either let me know during the session, or you can keep it anonymous by filling out the a Survey Monkey (I'll provide the link in the session).

<a href="https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/KFNMRFX"></a>

results.description:
Let's go for Central and South American food. 

www.laqchara.com 

This little hole in the wall is a sister place to Coffee, Tea, and Me, one of my favorite lunch and coffee spots in Melrose. La Qchara is closer to the Wakefield border. This place is open Wednesdays until 8:30 PM, but they are small and do not take reservations. If you can get there early and save us a table, please do so. I sometimes can't leave my office until a bit closer to 7:00, so I'm not guaranteeing seats, but I'm sure if we hang out and look hungry something might be arranged. 

Funny story, they told me about their new restaurant when I went into Coffee, Tea, and Me, and I googled it and googled it and googled it but I couldn't find it. Ends up I was using the actual Spanish spelling, La Cuchara (the word for spoon) and didn't get the literal  Q business of how they chose to name their restaurant. So of course I never found it on google.  

As always, I've got bananagrams if people want to linger. 

As usual, please don't RSVP and then don't come. I don't want to play bananagrams all by myself, nor munch of my share of yucca fries and fish tacos while staring at some empty chairs, and it kind of sucks when people just don't show up. If you can't come I just ask that you un RSVP yourself before the dinner starts, preferably earlier, and I won't count you as a NO SHOW. 

...because you wouldn't want to deny someone else the experience of Central/ South American food. Or that yummy rich beat juice business that I'm actually enjoying recently.

results.description:
With Regrets,

It is with disappointment, that it has become necessary for me to CANCEL producing line dancing nights while I am here in MA. I have moved from FL, selling my store, and shutting down life there that I had set up, to come here to care for my mom. She's 85, pretty 'with-it' and independent. But she really isn't able to do things like food shopping, or really fending for herself. So, my intention at first was to repair her house from last winter's damage, getting her the insurance money to keep and pay off credit cards left over from when my dad was with her. I have done that, but it is pretty apparent that she is still about $1700 a month short for bills, now that she doesn't have my dad's pension coming any longer.


So, I have had to get a local job to make up that shortfall. The job is at night, so I can NOT continue the line dancing. I am sorry. I had high hopes and went and spent over $1000 on new equipment, because I was pretty serious about being able to get country dancing out to new people in this area. I hope that happens for the 80+ people that joined Redneck Country Dancers on MeetUp.com, and the number of Facebook folks that joined Country Dance Nights on Facebook.


Again, I am sorry for the start & stop of trying to get the line dancing going. Good luck to all of you...Mike (Mitch) Pelletier

I will discontinue paying for this group this month. Again, my apologies.
results.name: With Regrets...

results.description:
Ellen Jaffe JonesThe Veg Coach

Creative Cook / Author / Consultant
From our test kitchen to your home kitchen

OK, show of hands.  How many of you eat quinoa as a side dish?
Most cooks use the protein-rich grain as a substitute for rice.
But, I've got a treat for you today.  It's a recipe for Quinoa crisp chocolate balls!
What a way to reward yourself for following a healthy lifestyle.

Find it below.

Consider this too as a tasty approach to getting people interested in coming to one of my FREE cooking classes. This week, Wednesday at 9pm EST, I'll be doing a free class prepping and serving 2 recipes from my book "Eat Vegan on $4 a Day." Bring any questions to our Google Hangout: 

https://plus.google.com/events/c0oegddjuh07utbrq1mv6vm1rfg

Happy cooking,

Ellen Jaffe Jones
The Veg Coach
http://www.vegcoach.com

Buy my books:

Paleo Vegan

Eat Vegan on $4 a Day

Kitchen Divided - Vegan Recipes for Semi-Vegan Households

This is a Quinoa crisp chocolate bar you might find at your local health food store.  
But, my recipe lets you create your own Quinoa chocolate treat.  

It'll satisfy your chocolate cravings and it's so easy to make.  

The recipe is below.

You're Going to Love This!  

Quinoa Crisp Chocolate Treats
by Ellen Jaffe Jones

INGREDIENTS 

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

PREPARATION INSTRUCTIONS

1 cup vegan chocolate chips
1/2 cup puffed quinoa
4 teaspoons coconut oil
1/8 teaspoon salt (optional)

Melt chocolate chips in a double-boiler, or place in a microwave-safe bowl and heat for about 60 seconds until the chips develop a slight sheen.  
Place all ingredients in a medium pot (or add to the double-boiler) and over medium heat, and stir constantly for about 5 minutes taking care not to burn the chocolate. 
Form small balls and place on a non-stick cookie sheet.  
Refrigerate for at least 60 minutes before serving.  
For those wanting to reduce fat intake, this can be made without the coconut oil, but make sure the chocolate chips are completely melted.

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball. 

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Thursday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

results.description:
Release Date:

November 22, 2015


Rating:

TV-14


Synopsis:

In November 1620, after 66 days at sea, the Mayflower arrived in New England’s Provincetown Harbor with 102 men, women and children aboard. The brutal journey across the ocean on a vessel never intended to carry passengers had left many sick, hungry and dying. And though the sight of land brought great relief, little did they know their journey had only just begun. National Geographic Channel’s two night movie event Saints & Strangers, premiering Nov 22-23 at 9/8c, goes deep inside the familiar historical account of Thanksgiving, revealing the trials and tribulations of the first settlers at Plymouth, and their complex relationship with the Native Americans. Starring Ray Stevenson, Vincent Kartheiser, Brían F. O’Byrne, Barry Sloane, Anna Camp, Raoul Trujillo, Michael Jibson, Kalani Queypo, Tatanka Means, with Natascha McElhone, and Ron Livingston, Saints & Strangers shines a light on the desperate and often reckless decisions that went into the founding of our country and the reverberations of those actions for centuries to come.

--

GETTING HERE

Join us at Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, 5th floor, Cozumel Room

• Optionally: Meet us at Venture Cafe for networking before the event. Venture Cafe serves as a physical nexus for helping innovators and entrepreneurs find one another and collaborate to bring their dreams to reality.  All attendees to the Cafe should adhere to the Venture Cafe contributor model (http://vencaf.org/thursdaycafeboston/contributor-model/) and credo (http://vencaf.org/credo/). Learn more here: vencaf.org.

--

QUESTIONS? NEED HELP?

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,

The French Cultural Center is hosting a free ($5.00 donation suggested) French film, "Tu Veux... ou Tu Veux Pas?" (2014) [The Missionaries ].

Even though this is a free event, a reservation is required.


You may register online at 

http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/events/scheduled-events/cine-club-de-lalliance-tu-veux-ou-tu-veux-pas/

or via phone at[masked]-0400.


When you register online there is a confusing message stating that members will be asked to show Member Card at the door.  This message does not apply to free events.  Just to reconfirm, this is a public and free event, however registration is required. 

This is a relatively small venue which seats approximately 70 people.  Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.

The film starts at 6:30 pm, however the meeting time for this event is set for 6:00 pm in the reading room.  The film will be presented in the adjacent room, the ballroom.  The plan is to gather and meet-up in the reading room and then go to the film viewing room at 6:30 pm.

I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

** *

Event Description

For November's Ciné-Club de l'Alliance, we're screening director Tonie Marshall's 2014 French romantic comedy, Tu veux...ou tu veux pas. The 88-minute film will be presented in its original French version, with English subtitles and the screening will conclude with an open discussion led by our in-house film expert, Barbara Bouquegneau.

About the Film
When his sex addiction costs him his job as a pilot, Lambert (Bruel) tries to reform himself through a new career as a couples therapist, and makes a vow to never again have sex without love. Unfortunately, his new colleague Judith (Marceau) happens to be a nymphomaniac with a taste for sleeping with her coworkers--and she's determined to have him next. Between their instant attraction and Judith's unrelenting (and decidedly unsubtle) attempts to seduce him, Lambert struggles to keep his promises to himself and to get what he ultimately wants from Judith: a relationship.

</a>


Directions and Parking Information


• Getting here via public transportation (MBTA)Green Line

Get off at Arlington station. Walk north along Arlington Street toward the Charles River. Turn left onto the third street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, at the opposite corner on the right.

Via the Orange Line or Commuter Rail

Get off either train at Back Bay Station. Walk north along Clarendon Street toward the Charles River. Turn right onto the fifth street, Marlborough Street. The Center is at the end of the block, on the left corner.

• Parking

Parking is available at the Boston Common Parking Garage (located at Zero Charles St, below the Boston Common Park) on Saturdays all day and on week days after 4pm for $10. Buy your discounted ticket with our receptionist.

<a href="http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/about-us/directions-hours/">http://www.frenchculturalcenter.org/index.cfm/about-us/directions-hours/
results.how_to_find_us: in the reading room at 6pm

Everything happening at this event will be related to the combination of "Music and Motion, through technology", and we have a host of brilliant people who will be demonstrating innovative tech and unlocking possibilities at this intersection.

results.description:
In a family where six successive generations of Quincy men held prominent public roles in the civic life of Boston and New England, the women in the family have long been overshadowed.  But in reality it is because of them that we know as much as we do about their husbands, fathers, and brothers. When we shine a light on the lives of the Quincy wives and daughters we learn about the role that intelligent, articulate, and engaged women played in the political and cultural life of the region. Please join us for a reception following the lecture.

Nancy Carlisle is the Senior Curator of Collections for Historic New England, where she has served for almost thirty years and where she oversees roughly 110,000 historic artifacts in 36 house museums located in five New England states. She is the author of the award-winning book: Cherished Possessions, A New England Legacy and the co-author with Melinda Nasardinov of America’s Kitchens. She has spent the past three years focusing on the Quincy House and the family who lived there as part of a major reinstallation that was completed this year.

FREE
results.name: Remarkable Women of the Quincy Family: A Lecture

results.description:
Dr. Sanjiv Chopra, a world-class physician, best selling author and motivational speaker, will focus on leadership, healthy living and medicine, especially for young people. His philosophy closely aligns with Tremont's philosophy of education.

"The mind is only one part of the human triumvirate.  I want to inspire others to live healthier, balanced lives and to make a difference in this world by leading. All of us have the potential to become exemplary leaders at many levels. To do so, one must have a sense of purpose, dare to dream big, and live a life of integrity so that others will be inspired to embark on their own leadership journey."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5GZJZB0lJxE

Tickets


RSVP here, and reserve a seat:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tremont-forum-series-presents-dr-sanjiv-chopra-tickets-18653657592

Speaker

https://img.evbuc.com/https%3A%2F%2Fimg.evbuc.com%2Fhttps%253A%252F%252Fcdn.evbuc.com%252Fimages%252F15511357%252F86098621847%252F1%252Foriginal.jpg%3Frect%3D212%252C0%252C998%252C499%26s%3Dfed30153fdd9b88a451e9670fd87ae99?h=150&w=300&s=60fe91b8ad7ae1070ab160d242b270a1

Dr. Chopra is a professor of medicine and former the faculty dean for continuing medical education at Harvard Medical School. Additionally, Dr. Chopra serves as the James Tullis Firm Chief in the department of medicine at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.  Dr. Chopra is a leading academic in continuing medical education and reaches out to 80,000 clinicians in 150 countries each year. 

Dr. Chopra is the recipient of numerous awards and accolades. He is a master of the American College of Physicians and received the American Gastroentrological Association's Distinguished Educator Award. 

In 2013, Dr. Chopra and his brother, Dr. Deepak Chopra, published the book Brotherhood: Dharma, Destiny and The American Dream. He is also the author of
- Leadership by Example: The Ten Key Principles of All Great Leaders,
- Doctor Chopra Says: Medical Facts and Myths Everyone Should Know, and
- Live Better, Live Longer: The New Studies That Reveal What's Really Good---and Bad---for Your Health.

Read more about Dr. Chopra at his website, http://sanjivchopra.com/. 


About the Tremont School Forum Series:

The Tremont School Forum is an occasional series of lectures, events, and activities that explore contemporary issues in the field of education.

About the Tremont School:

The Tremont School is a progressive, independent, co-educational day school in metrowest Boston for grades 5 – 12, specifically designed to offer a lively, project-based curriculum for a deliberately diverse group of students.  Visit Tremont and experience a new kind of school.  http://tremontschool.org

results.description:
Cambridge meetup is back! We are going to have this event every other week!


http://www.championscambridge.com/


As usual, please bring your driver's license or passport, if you would like to have alcohol. They are strict about IDs, No IDs no booze.  But people under 21 are welcome as well to this event  - Champions is almost as much a restaurant as a bar and you need not order a drink.


You are responsible for your own consumption and please start and settle your own tab. Please bring your Credit/Debit card or cash and start your tab with the waiter.    Please be sure to tip - we suggest 20% as it is a lot of extra trouble for them to do separate tabs, but it saves us work and allows people to leave at different times.  But first be sure that the tip is not included already - it usually is not but occasionally is, at 18%, if there is a large group, in which case you need not tip additional.  (If you know the price of what you ordered, and add 6.25% MA meals tax, and that is the total, they have NOT added in the tip.)

RSVP required. Please sign up. If you RSVP "Yes," but your plans change, please change your RSVP to "No" so others can sign up. Deadline for reservation is 3PM as we need to get an accurate head count for the reservation. On nights when we are expecting many people, we limit the RSVP number to 27. However, if you'd like to attend, but can't RSVP, send a message to an organizer, as we may be able to get you in.


Champions is located at MIT/Kendall Sq. station. If you come from Boston side, you will see right in front of the T exit. It is part of the Marriott. Even though the address is listed as 50 Broadway, you can really only see it from the Main street side.  We are usually either in the separate room toward the Marriott lobby, or else at two long central tables in the room to the right of the host station.

results.description:
Some think living free of  pain and suffering is impossible. Some think that enduring pain and loss will break them. What if that wasn't the case? It isn't and Lee has had success in this area which he graciously shares with others.    

Our Topic This Evening Will ....

Give those who attend the opportunity to learn tools for living  a more equanimous life with purpose and understanding. Lee will share his stories of hardship and how he decided to transform and where his journey has taken him. 

Lee Weinstein has over 20 years experience as a coach, having in the 1990s supervised 42 Landmark Forums, been a founding member of Coach University, coached executives at AT&T professionally, and as a volunteer coached men in relationships for over 10 years.  More relevant to this evening, about 6 years ago, after some intense periods of suffering, which included events such as his mother's suicide, the deaths of two sweethearts, a divorce, and deaths of several friends, Lee got to a point in 2009 where he was intensely motivated to end suffering in his life, or get as close to that as possible.  His inspiration was Eckhart Tolle.  Lee asked himself "Could I ever experience life as he does?"  It took about two years of focus on that goal, and the answer turned out to be yes.

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies: 
  *  What is a Heartbeat Salon?  
  *  Where are Heartbeat Salons

results.description:
I am dropping the controversial this time and going for the tame Film Discussion Topic because the controversial was deemed limiting! However! This will be an interesting and fun discussion on remakes of films. 

We seem to be seeing a ton of remakes these days. There are the remakes from the generations past and also remakes of foreign movies. What do you think are good remakes and what have been god awful? What components make for a good/bad remake? Know of another type of remake or other remade film? Comment below!

Note: We are mixing things up and meeting at a different location this time!

Suggested Film List includes but is not limited to:

Generational Remake

Ocean's Eleven
3:10 to Yuma
Total Recall
All of the Superhero Films
Lone Ranger
Alice in the Wonderland
Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory
Planet of the Apes
Annie
Alfie
Sabrina
Carrie
Dinner for Schmucks

Foreign Remakes Oldboy 

Nine Months
The Departed
3 Men and a Baby
The Talented Mr Ripley
True Lies
No Reservation
The Lake House
Shall We Dance?
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
results.name: Film Discussion Topic: Film Remakes!

results.description:
PlantPure Nation members of Boston

Premiere of PlantPure Nation in Cambridge, MA!
Date: November 12, 2015
Time: 7 PM
Theatre: Landmark Kendall Square, 355 Binney Street, Cambridge, MA, 02139

PlantPure Nation premiere in Boston has already occurred!


Help us promote the film by sharing this meme and information with those in your social networks. Tickets for many premieres around the USA have been sold out, so it's wise to purchase your ticket online now rather that waiting to purchase it at the door.

Thank you for your help! 
PlantPure Nation Rollout Team

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
One Kendall Square at 355 Binney Street
[masked]

$11.00 - general admission for all films
$9.00 for 'seniors' 62 and over, and for children - and for 'matinees'
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
INFO: 9 Screens DLP Digital Projection and Sound. Operated by Landmark since 1995. The Kendall Square Cinema is located in Cambridge between Historic Kendall Square and Central Square near the intersection of Binney Street and Cardinal Medeiros Avenue, next to the MIT campus. Since opening its doors in September 1995, it has become one of Landmark Theatres' most successful venues. It also ranks among the most successful, beloved and architecturally intriguing homes for independent film, foreign language cinema, restored classics and documentaries in the nation. The Kendall Square Cinema has been host to many special events, including local premieres, benefit screenings and film festivals. Additionally, the theatre complex has won numerous awards, making it one of Boston's cultural epicenters.

PARKING: $3.00 validated four-hour parking is available in the Kendall Square Parking Garage.

Best Cinema of Boston (2014, 2012, 1998, 1997, 1996) - Boston Magazine

Top 5 Indie Cinemas in Boston (2012 Boston A-List) - WGBH

Best First-Run Movie Theater (2008, 2007, 2006, 2004, 2003 Best of Boston) - Boston Phoenix

Dig This Award for Small / Medium Theatre (2007) -Boston Weekly Dig

Best Movie Theater in Boston (2006 A-List Contest) - CBS4

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: Take the Red Line towards the Kendall/MIT stop. Upon exiting the stop you will see the Marriot Hotel. Go through the lobby of the Marriot Hotel to Broadway. With the Marriot behind you facing Broadway St., make a left and walk down Broadway until you pass over the train tracks. After crossing the train tracks stay on your right until you see Kendall Square on your right. Walk all the way across the Kendall Square courtyard, passing the Blue Room and UPS Store through an arch at which time you will be on Binney St. At that time you will be facing the Kendall Square Garage. We are to the left of the garage.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

results.description:
Inspiring conversation plus wine and craft brews for $5 a glass.

Expect interesting topics and trends with local experts, while enjoying a drink in great company. Think happy hour, but smarter.

Get details and tickets here http://www.wgbh.org/events/event.cfm?eid=Happy%20Hour%3A%20Driving%20Change%20in%20Politics-66

$10 entry fee however use promo code HappyHour to get 100% ticket discount

Happy Hour: Driving Change in Politics

Hear from some of the fresh, new voices redefining politics as usual in Massachusetts.

Meet the Host

Edgar Herwick is the guy behind WGBH's Curiosity Desk, where the quest is to dig a little deeper into (and sometimes look a little askew at) topics in the news, and search for answers to questions posed by the world around us. His features can be seen on WGBH's Greater Boston and heard on 89.7 WGBH's Morning Edition and All Things Considered. He also appears regularly with Jim Braude and Margery Eagan on Boston Public Radio. Follow him on Twitter @ebherwick3.

You must be at least 21 years old to attend.

Talk and tag #BostonTalks
results.name: Happy Hour at WGBH Thursday November 12th

results.description:
How Do we open up our hearts to find Joy in our life?
Life hits us with obstacles and challenges that keep us from readily accessing Joy.
Do you feel stuck in your life? We get stuck in thought patterns and behaviors in our life that prevent us from creating the life of our dreams. To move forward we must re-purpose what is holding us back and develop new ways to approach life by redefining our underlying beliefs.This is deeply transformational work that will elevate your personal experience of life, enabling you to have deeper relationships that work, the ability to go with the flow and experience great Joy.

In this series of workshops in a supportive group setting you will explore feelings, aspects of ourselves and ways to balance that control our ability to experience more Joy. Each workshop we will work with our own personal healing through the use of visualization and high vibrational essential oils to help us move through our personal growth.

This once a month 6 part workshop series includes a journal, sample size vials of Young Living Essential oil and recorded visualizations each month to continue your work at home. $150.00. The Workshops will explore Forgiveness, Inner Child, Release, Harmony and Valor.
This is presented by Charlene Anestis Reiki Master and Spiritual Alchemist.
Reserve your spot for all 6 sessions
Drop in session 30$ reserve your spot here  

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/essential-oil-tickets-19244160803
results.name: Essential Oil Alchemy

results.description:
Yang style Tai Chi is a Chinese Martial Art learned through flowing movement and practiced with focused breathing and a calm mind to develop health, internal awareness, and martial power.  A type of moving meditation, the slow, smooth movements gently stimulate the internal organs and joints, and improve energy circulation.

Tai Chi has many benefits including:

Increase energy, Balance, Flexibility, Internal awareness and power, and ease symptoms of many health problems

Tai Chi is a gentle, low-impact exercise suitable for adults of any age and varying physical ability.  From beginners to advanced practitioners, this program is a great fit for everyone interested in learning this ancient art.

Class session run for 10 week at a time.  Sessions are $50 a person for one time a week or $75 a person for two times a week.
results.name: Tai Chi

This group meets every Thursday at 7:00 pm. for an hour and 15 minutes of meditation and mutual support. If your looking for someone to do something to you, or for you, keep looking ! If your willing to show up and work on yourself ,with kindness and patience, that's what we're doing together here. The average attendance for this group is probably 4 or 5 people, even though most don't RSVP on meetup, so don't be afraid that you will be the only one there if you don't see other RSVPs.(Is that a word?)

  Thank you for your kind attention, Randy

results.description:
Dr. Sanjiv Chopra, a world-class physician, best selling author and motivational speaker, will focus on leadership, healthy living and medicine, especially for young people. His philosophy closely aligns with Tremont's philosophy of education.

"The mind is only one part of the human triumvirate.  I want to inspire others to live healthier, balanced lives and to make a difference in this world by leading. All of us have the potential to become exemplary leaders at many levels. To do so, one must have a sense of purpose, dare to dream big, and live a life of integrity so that others will be inspired to embark on their own leadership journey."

Tickets

RSVP here, and reserve a seat:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tremont-forum-series-presents-dr-sanjiv-chopra-tickets-18653657592

Speaker

https://img.evbuc.com/https%3A%2F%2Fimg.evbuc.com%2Fhttps%253A%252F%252Fcdn.evbuc.com%252Fimages%252F15511357%252F86098621847%252F1%252Foriginal.jpg%3Frect%3D212%252C0%252C998%252C499%26s%3Dfed30153fdd9b88a451e9670fd87ae99?h=150&w=300&s=60fe91b8ad7ae1070ab160d242b270a1

Dr. Chopra is a professor of medicine and former the faculty dean for continuing medical education at Harvard Medical School. Additionally, Dr. Chopra serves as the James Tullis Firm Chief in the department of medicine at Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.  Dr. Chopra is a leading academic in continuing medical education and reaches out to 80,000 clinicians in 150 countries each year. 

Dr. Chopra is the recipient of numerous awards and accolades. He is a master of the American College of Physicians and received the American Gastroentrological Association's Distinguished Educator Award. 

In 2013, Dr. Chopra and his brother, Dr. Deepak Chopra, published the book Brotherhood: Dharma, Destiny and The American Dream. He is also the author of
- Leadership by Example: The Ten Key Principles of All Great Leaders, 
- Doctor Chopra Says: Medical Facts and Myths Everyone Should Know, and 
- Live Better, Live Longer: The New Studies That Reveal What's Really Good---and Bad---for Your Health. 

Read more about Dr. Chopra at his website, http://sanjivchopra.com/. 

Tremont School

The Tremont School is a progressive, independent, co-educational day school in metrowest Boston for grades 5 – 12, specifically designed to offer a lively, project-based curriculum for a deliberately diverse group of students.  Visit Tremont and experience a new kind of school
results.name: Tremont: Happiness and Living with Purpose -- Keys to a Joy-Filled Life

results.description:
We'll run routes along the Charles River Greenway, Riverwalk, Newton and neighborhoods of Waltham, with options to extend for those who are looking to add distance (or end early!) Afterward we'll hop into the bar for post-run drinks. 

We meet in front of Shoppers Cafe and leave at 7:00p. There should be plenty of parking on the street and in the neighborhood. All levels are welcome, with a broad range of paces!

Runs are typically 3-5 miles. 

As our daylight becomes more limited, it is highly recommended to at least wear bright clothing, and also to consider bringing a reflective vest and/or lamp.  


See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: In front of Shoppers Cafe
results.name: Thursday Night Run for Thirsty Runners (3-6 Miles, All Levels!)

results.description:
Get Prepared in the Off Season!!! Coach Tony's Swimming for Triathletes Class at the BU Fitrec through December. Tuesday and Thursday evenings 7PM to 8PM. 9/15 through 12/3

***You Must Register Online***

Click Here to Register if You're Interested

An incredible facility! This is a freestyle focused set of sessions designed to improve swimming mechanics and techniques for triathlon.  

The lanes are broken up by ability. In total swimmers will swim anywhere from 2,000 to 3,000 yards total.

You'll get a Swimming for Triathletes eBook, and virtual clinic with the class.Video swim stroke analysis is available for all swimmers. 

We work on deep water starts for triathlon, sighting, drafting and other open water swim techniques to prepare you for triathlon swimming.
results.how_to_find_us: On the Pool Deck by lane #1 and the Starting Blocks
results.name: Swimming for Triathletes (Tues./Thurs. Night)

results.description:
"A universal theology is impossible, but a universal experience is not only possible but necessary. It is this experience toward which the course is directed." (ACIM Manual for Teachers)

Designed to correct perception and lead to a universal experience of knowledge, A Course In Miracles has been translated into 23 languages, is referenced and utilized by many of today's most reknowned spiritual teachers, and has inspired countless books and curriculums based on its teachings. But it can be a difficult book to grasp. It is lengthy, the writing is abstract, and its use of Christian terminology alienates many.

And yet it has become one of the most influential spiritual books of today. Join us as we dive into it, and are led to understand its principles against the backdrop of our own personal experiences and insights. Beginner as well as advanced Course students are welcome. We'll start with a short meditation, and then use a reading from the Course as an entry point into our time together. Cost $5 per person.

Bringing a copy of the book is helpful, but not necessary. Recommended (but again not necessary) is the combined volume that includes the three supplements (Clarification of Terms; Psychotherapy: Purpose, Process, and Practice; The Song of Prayer), available online from The Foundation For Inner Peace at acim.org.
results.how_to_find_us: From Concord St.: we're 4/10th's of a mile down Russell St. on the right, the driveway after Fraser Farm.
results.name: Join us as we discuss A Course In Miracles and apply its principles to our lives

group.name: A Course In Miracles Discussion Group - Carlisle

results.description:
Thursday night figure drawing has an emphasis on one long pose, giving time for more involved approaches.  Painters and drawers welcome to this informal and supportive group, meeting in Damon's painting studio.


A few warm up quick poses will be followed by a long (2.5 hour) pose, with breaks for the model.

Members pay $10 as on Monday night, non-member drop-in is $25.  Membership fee for each month of $25 brings discounts on drawing and painting sessions and classes.  Pay membership fee online (see left-hand column) via paypal or credit card, or in person with cash or check.  First session of the month would therefore be $35 ($25 membership fee plus $10 session fee) and each session thereafter would be $10. 

Thanks!
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Central Street and Vernon Street, big brick building.  Park on Vernon street in front of building or in lot behind building.
results.name: Long Pose Drawing and Painting Session

results.description:
Come join us over fab food and drink at SIP as we discuss Me Before You, by Jojo Moyes! Here's a description:

"They had nothing in common until love gave them everything to lose . . .

Louisa Clark is an ordinary girl living an exceedingly ordinary life—steady boyfriend, close family—who has barely been farther afield than their tiny village. She takes a badly needed job working for ex–Master of the Universe Will Traynor, who is wheelchair bound after an accident. Will has always lived a huge life—big deals, extreme sports, worldwide travel—and now he’s pretty sure he cannot live the way he is.

Will is acerbic, moody, bossy—but Lou refuses to treat him with kid gloves, and soon his happiness means more to her than she expected. When she learns that Will has shocking plans of his own, she sets out to show him that life is still worth living.

A Love Story for this generation, Me Before You brings to life two people who couldn’t have less in common—a heartbreakingly romantic novel that asks, What do you do when making the person you love happy also means breaking your own heart?"


Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Ongoing class in Medieval and Renaissance Longsword in the tradition of Johannes Lichtenauer.


The Longsword is the iconic fantasy Knight's sword - a two-handed, straight blade with a cross guard. The weapon may seem to be simple at first but is in reality a weapon of finesse and skill.


The class covers all the basics of footwork, attacks and defenses. Drills are developed from simple to complex; from rigidly choreographed to open-ended. Timing, distance and judgement are developed.


All classes begin with a Strength & Conditioning program designed to physically prepare one for fighting with the sword. Elements develop agility, core stability and power.

results.description:
NOVEMBER IS HERE. The weather's colder. You're trying to avoid your family. What better time to get warm with some piping hot Sketchhaus?

First up: it's Lisa Lang and Joanna Banana Hammock's 1-800 You Know Her! The Ladies at 1-800 You Know Her are excited to bring you an autumnal extravaganza featuring characters you all know and love... well, sort of. Want your life to be forever altered through the power of dance? Do you need to make your own body gems? Would it kill you to call your mother once in a while? Laugh, cry, and cringe with us on a multimedia journey through the season.

THEN YOUR HEADLINER: Boston's best roving storytelling show, featuring scripted comedy monologues by some of the city's - and country's! - funniest people. Storytellers are given a single topic and then spin their hilarious tales out. Featured everywhere from The Boston Comedy Arts Festival, Johnny D's Comedy Presents, ImprovBoston, and the Women In Comedy Festival, Wild Memory Nation promises true stories, real funny. This month featuring the theme "Exit Music," and the amazing talents of: Kelly MacFarland (Last Comic Standing), Allen McRae (Terrible People), Lauren Walleser (Mister Bismuth), Wes Hazard (It Just Got Weirdo), & Matt Wiffin (Vitamin Snake).

FINALLY: complete with your ticket to Sketchhaus is OPENHAUS, the one and only sketch comedy open mic! Sign up early, bring your untried and untested sketches, and we'll put them on stage! PLUS: your host for the evening is all-around great and funny Paul Landwehr! We might give you turkey! (By law we can't give you turkey.) An absolutely packed night of comedy, and it's all for you!
results.name: Sketchhaus Presents: Wild Memory Nation & 1-800 You Know Her

results.description:
NUTSHELL - every week day, 12:15ish until 1:45ish, Cumnock Turf Fields at Harvard Stadium, games of 4v4 up to 10v10 or larger depending on who shows, bring a white shirt and a dark/colored shirt (but not a gray one), almost never canceled, read below for more details before asking questions that are answered here, and read the comments for today's meetup to see if there is anything important about today.

http://goo.gl/I0tPQQ

GETTING THERE BY PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Harvard Square is the closest T stop (red line).  Check Google Maps or other to find fastest way there from wherever you are.

GETTING THERE BY RIDE SHARE - a lot of players in this meetup come by car and are nice enough to offer rides to others. Best hope of getting a ride is leaving a comment here asking if anybody is driving and willing to pick you up.

PARKING - you must park at one of the metered spots if you park on Harvard property near the stadium.  They will patrol for cars parked illegally.

COST - free while we play outdoors.

ATTIRE - Bring a *white* shirt and a dark/vivid color shirt so we can easily divide into teams.  DO NOT BRING A GRAY SHIRT- you will annoy a lot of people if you do. Turf shoes or cleats recommended, and sneakers are fine.  Shin-guards optional- most people don't wear them. Bring a ball if you have one.

RSVP and CANCELING - the sooner you RSVP, the better.  That said, most people don't RSVP until around 10:30am the day of the meetup, so we make the call around 11:15am the day of the meetup about whether a game needs to be canceled.  Check here right before heading over.

ETIQUETTE - we have A LOT of players in this meetup and play every (week)day. Each day is a different mix of people, skill levels, and attitudes.  Most people playing do this for fun and/or exercise in the middle of the day.  Please respect this by at least following these unspoken rules that we have:

1) You may not hurt anybody- especially yourself. All of us just want to safely return to the office/class afterward.

2) Do not yell at, criticize, or offer unsolicited "tips" to other players unless they ask for your opinion. It ruins an otherwise fun, all-skill-levels game. If you do this often, you may be asked to find another meetup.

3) Be the first to get the ball if it goes out of bounds. Especially if you kicked it last or are the closest one to the ball.

4) Fighting is prohibited. We've never come close to having a problem with this, but better stated aloud. If it gets physical, we may call the police as it becomes a felony/legal matter.

WHAT ELSE - All skill levels welcome- it's a big mix. While these are general guidelines, always read the comments section for the latest updates for today's meetup.
results.name: Friday Lunchtime Soccer (OUTDOOR)

All Are Invited: Lunchtime Meet Up at Rebecca's Café!
 SPC members have long expressed an interest in an additional channel for unstructured networking and just plain schmoozing about their business triumphs and trials.
Here's how it works: You just show up! No need to pay a fee.
Rick Pollack of Presentation Medic, a member of the SPC Board, has volunteered to anchor this gathering. This meeting is a bring your own agenda, or just enjoy lunch with other consultants.
Find yourself something appealing to nosh on, settle at the cash register, and join the group. We've picked 1 p.m. on a Friday as our start time to avoid the crush and let people take as much time as they feel they can afford...and maybe start a new conversation they can pick up later!
Mark your calendar now ... you don't even have to sign up on our website!

results.description:
An audience favorite Wambura Mitaru. The classically trained Nairobi, Kenya, native has performed throughout the world, receiving acclaim for both covers and original songs that pay tribute to African history and tradition. Her new single, “Work in Progress,” which she performed with gifted band the Maua on a rooftop construction site in hard hats, is a sophisticated hybrid of soul, R&B, and jazz. This eclectic mix is something the band is relentlessly dedicated to and that they work to perfect in their animated performances. Complete with catchy lyrics, which Mitaru encourages the audience to sing along, and a captivating, robust vocal performance, Mitaru and the Maua’s live performances never fail to delight.


Since fall of 2015 will be her last semester at Berklee, she and her friends will share the music that has carried them through their Berklee journey. Come and enjoy their second edition entitled Asante Part II (asante means "thank you" in Swahili). Fall is also Thanksgiving season, and so asante will be the general theme of everything. Come sing and dance along with Mitaru and her friends.

https://youtu.be/Fu_iAWHH8Ho

This event is cross posted in:

Social Fun http://www.meetup.com/SocialFun/events/224468962/


Fun Bostonians http://www.meetup.com/Fun-Bostonians/events/224468648/


The-Middle-30-45-yrs http://www.meetup.com/The-Middle-30-45-yrs/events/224468944/

results.description:
I have recently been organizing a weekly Ethnic Eats MeetUP with the North Shore Women's Group, I am expanding my circle to include a more gender-diverse audience that includes places that are closer to Boston than they are to New Hampshire. This group will include the Cambridge Boston Ethnic Dining and may be a mixed gender group. 

Join me next week Friday night to try Moroccan food. I have never been here but they were more than happy to work with me on a reservation and will also do separate checks. This is where you can find the menu:

http://boston.eater.com/2014/6/30/6199891/you-could-be-eating-this-moroccan-food-in-somerville

I typically bring my yellow Bananagrams game as a table marker for my Meetup groups. Often we play a game or three after we eat if time permits or the restaurant atmosphere allows. 

As an event organizer I also have low tolerance for no shows. Be aware that if you do not show up and do not cancel your RSVP I will not permit you to attend my events in the future. I hate eating alone and I hate waiting for ghosts...and it would be a lot of Moroccan food for the three parties of me, myself, and I. Be decent and let me know if you can't come, even if it is the day of the event.

results.description:
For those of you not going to Sissy K's (but maybe we can join them later), --Sissy K's is for the young crowd (ew!)

Back due to popular demand! Huge capacity (360) always popular with Meetups, 2 giant rooms. Dress is casual. Just a bit pricy but manager Frank is absolutely fabulous he usually greets people in person.

Popular with Meetups, this venue is named after Carrie Nation, the key founder of Prohibition. There is a photo gallery between the two huge rooms at this venue showing Carrie Nation. Reportedly, she used to go around with a horde of admirers smashing the windows of pubs with an axe. Thus started Prohibition. A Speakeasy lounge was the name for clandestine drinking places during Prohibition. Her motto was, "he whose lips touch wine shall not touch mine"

This is a rolling come and go as you can event. Meaning people trickle in trickle out. Some folks come just for a drink, others hang out and chat for a few hours. There's good food here too but ordering food is optional meaning there will be no pressure to, in the Speakeasy.

Please bring cash & pay as you go! MBTA Park St. (green/ Red line), then a pretty short walk up the hill.

Look forward to seeing you again!

results.description:
The Love, Intimacy and Sexuality Workshops

Life isn’t a puzzle to be solved, it’s an adventure, an education, and a celebration to be lived.

HAI workshops offer tools and techniques that help individuals and couples (traditional and non traditional) grow and evolve.  We believe that everyone wants and deserves to love and be loved and that our capability to love others is very related to our ability to love ourselves.

Our weekend workshops are presented in a progression of “levels,” taken in order, presented in a caring, supportive and safe environment to help you achieve your goals and discover the ingredients for your happy, healthy, love-filled life.

Level 1 – Love Is a Miracle

Begin with our Level 1 – Love Is a Miracle workshop.   Here you will experience love, trust and relationship in ways you may never before have thought possible.  Through a combination of information, voluntary participation in exercises, and sharing our experiences – all in a room filled with love and support – you will:

♥  Discover you are beautiful and lovable, just as you are.

♥  Let go of your fear and shame that get in the way of love and intimacy

♥  Practice speaking and listening from your heart

♥  Accept and love your body, as it is today

♥  Change habits and patterns that no longer serve you

♥  Feel the support of loving community

♥  Take risks, have fun, change your life

During your Level 1 – Love Is a Miracle workshop weekend you can expect to gently move through the layers of pretense, negative beliefs, fears and protective behaviors that have prevented you from receiving and giving love.  Here you can uncover, and enhance your passion for living, natural appreciation and acceptance of yourself and others.

For more information, please email - Khafiya and Debbie at [masked]
results.name: Love is a Miracle - A Residential Weekend Workshop

group.name: HAI East Coast: Workshops on Love, Intimacy and Sexuality

results.description:
Many of you may have had a "taste" of Shadow Work at a Heartbeat Salon, or have heard of this work from others. Now is your chance to experience the transformative potential of a Shadow Work weekend. 

Facilitated by Mark Massoni and Karin Green

Shadow Work® invites you to discover parts of yourself you have hidden or denied. By bringing these parts out of shadow in a safe, experiential setting, you can unlock the power of your true self, with all your gifts and strengths – even those you may have disowned.

Shadow Work® offers us the opportunity to:

• Increase ability to make powerful choices; feel appreciated for who you are (Sovereign)

• Develop new solutions for old problems; understand persistent patterns (Magician)

• Deepen your capacity for intimacy; activate your creative talents (Lover)

• Improve your ability to set boundaries and deal with money (Warrior)


Cost: $445 if deposit paid by Nov 1, 2015. After Nov 1, $495.

We are offering a special discount of 10% to PGN members.

$100 non-refundable deposit required to reserve your space.

Pre-registration required. This is a non-residential seminar. Participants are responsible for their own food and lodging.

For more information, contact Karin at [masked],[masked] or Mark at [masked],[masked]


“Mark and Karin’s Shadow Process Workshop melds mind, body and spirit in a dance of emotional transformation. They facilitate with deep connection and love. They lead from the heart creating a safe, rich space for interactive growth and rebirth.” ~ Bill Foster
results.name: Shadow Wisdom: Transformational Shadow Work Seminar

results.description:
Why do 70% of Asian Americans with serious mental illness refuse to seek help? Why not create a secure, mobile-friendly website that neutralizes stigmas with videos of Asian Americans describing real problems and treatment? A site that is sensitive to cultural and language barriers, that provides important, accurate information and that connects Asian Americans with peers and local, professional help via a geo-locater. A partnership of 40+ organizations -- Together Empowering Asian Minds (T.E.A.M.) intends to make this website a reality!

TEAM will screen short videos depicting Asian Americans coping with mental illness at this event. Please share your ideas for creating this innovative website so that Asian Americans can access vital information without time and space constraints – Talk about breaking through silences and service silos!!

The event is FREE but RSVP is required:  https://team2015.eventbrite.com

<a href="https://team2015.eventbrite.com"></a>

Key Partners for this project:

·  Asian Women for Health

·  Breaking Silences Project

·  Cambridge Health Alliance

·  Health Innovators

·  Japanese Bostonians Support Line

·  Lowell Community Health Center

·  Saheli, Support & Friendship for

   South Asian Women & Families 

·  Transformation Center

·  WGBH World Channel

results.description:
With Greg Kaminsky – initiate and scholar of several esoteric traditions and producer / host of the Occult of Personality podcast at occultofpersonality.net.

Spiritual Alchemy – a western esoteric tradition that employs the metaphor of laboratory alchemical transmutation in working with meditation, breathing, and ritual techniques to transform one’s consciousness.

This class is designed to introduce the basic philosophy and initial practices to anyone interested in a simple, but powerful traditional technique that has been used to gain spiritual insight and illumination for ages.

It includes:

• Short talk on the history of alchemy

• Intro to the philosophy of alchemy and the proper state of mind required to enter the work

• What makes this practice ‘spiritual’ alchemy

• Discussion of how intentionally doing this practice has the power to transform consciousness

• Working with specific techniques of breathing, meditation, and ritual

• Presentation of a daily practice

Techniques of spiritual alchemy have been used for thousands of years with reproducible results. Clarity of mind, calmness, and increased energy may be side effects, but the goal of this practice is illumination – to transmute the lead of everyday experience into the gold of witnessing the miracle of divine creation.

The methods we’ll be discussing are integral to the esoteric traditions of Hermeticism and Rosicrucianism. We’ll explore the foundations, theory and practice of this royal Art to provide students with the basics required to begin their own daily practice.

Greg Kaminsky is the host and producer of the Occult of Personality podcast, a highly regarded and long-running podcast that explores the occult and esoteric with authors and experts in the field. His desire to create the Occult of Personality podcast in 2006 began with a life-long compulsion to learn more about ancient civilizations, world religions, symbolism, and the underlying hidden wisdom which they contain, but only convey to those with eyes to see and ears to hear. With well over 150 episodes completed and tens of thousands of listeners every month, the podcast continues to grow in popularity and prestige. You can find Occult of Personality podcast at http://occultofpersonality.net/.

As part of the journey in learning about the occult and esoteric while doing the podcast, Greg became an initiate in several traditions including Illuminism and Freemasonry. In 2007, he was consecrated as a Bishop in the Gnostic and Apostolic lines of succession by T Allen Greenfield on Mt. Arabia. Additionally, Greg is a scholar of the Western esoteric tradition currently pursuing a graduate degree in Medieval Studies, focusing on Cabala.

Greg has been practicing meditation regularly for more than 15 years and spiritual alchemy for more than 9 of those. He has led classes, workshops, and individual teachings on the subject since 2010.

Additionally, his understanding and experience continues to evolve to better aid those who wish to learn this method of spiritual practice.

Friday, November 13, 6:30 – 8:30 pm

$25
results.name: Intro to Spiritual Alchemy: Using Meditation to Transform Consciousness

results.description:
Simply put, scratching is the art of manipulating the playback of a record. It first began in the mid 1970's and has become a huge part of hip hop, as well as other genre's of music. The turntable was not invented as an instrument, people made it into one. Instructor Schuyler Stevens will teach students fundamental scratch techniques to build a foundation for improvising, creating, and performing a scratch routine. These scratch techniques include: 

Open fader: Baby scratch, drag, scribble
Closed fader: Stab, chirp

Schuyler Stevens started out in Burlington Vermont learning how to DJ and make music when he was 15. He got his own pair of turntables and inherited a small portion of his parents record collection and was off at light speed, challenging himself and pushing his own limits ever since. Schuyler moved to Boston and attended The New England Institute of Art when he was 18 to continue his pursuit for more knowledge. Since going to school, Stevens has been gigging as a DJ/turntablist in the local Boston scene as well as in Brooklyn, NY. He has also been tracking and producing songs for multiple MC's around Boston. His music draws inspiration from old records, and mixes sounds of vintage samples with modern day synthesis, recording, and processing techniques. Schuyler believes that you can never stop learning, there will always be somebody who can show you something you never thought was possible, and in turn inspire you to push your own boundaries beyond what you imagined you could do. It is an ongoing loop perpetuated by people of like minds all striving for the same musical bliss, but in their own unique ways. In the world of music, anything and everything is possible.
results.name: Fundamental Scratch Techniques [11/13] #FREE

Join the Cambridge Water Department and research astronomer Dr. Joshua Roth for a glimpse at the heavens at Payson Park Reservoir in Belmont!

Unbeknownst to many, this reservoir is the covered holding tank for purified drinking water before it is gravity-fed to Cambridge residents. Atop millions of gallons of water, we will explore the cosmos using telescopes, learning about the wonders of the night sky, how to identify seasonal constellations, and much more. Be sure to bundle up for the weather of the evening! All ages welcome.

 Please register for this event with [masked] for planning purposes. We’ll have lots of interactive indoor activities in the case of inclement weather!

Hello BSAP Sisters!

You are welcome to join us for our monthly Bible Study and Fellowship. 


This group is a great place to get to know other women in the Boston area by studying the Word of God, encouraging one another in our work/scholarship, and building a social network in an informal environment.  We discuss a variety of topics that are relevant to our growth as individuals and communities.  Feel free to invite other sisters, and bring a small dish or a snack to share with the group. 

Buses close to my home: 87, 77, 79, 350 (Red Line access), and 80 (Green Line access).  Check https://www.google.com/maps for exact directions. Street parking available.

If you cannot make this event and have already said you're attending, please be sure to update your RSVP status.  Thank you!

Khalilah

BSAP Ministry Team

with Whispering Deer

Appreciative joy is the mature expression of the awakened heart. It is the capacity to rejoice in the happiness and good fortune of others. Through this practice we learn that happiness doesn’t diminish when we share it, rather it multiplies. It increases our capacity for empathy. It is a heart that has lightness and simplicity in it. Appreciative joy brings unfettered joy in just being. Can we let go of our protective armor and survival tactics? And then watch the magic happen. Come and join us in breaking down the boundaries of separation that keep us isolated and alienated, and instead, experience a sense of wholeness, collectedness, and connection.

Donation welcome.

About Whispering Deer

Meditation is my primary spiritual practice. Each year, I spend 8 weeks in silence, working with various meditation techniques, accessing deep states of consciousness and expanded awareness. This work has led me to experience the transformative power of the awakened heart, resulting in the development of the Brahma Vihara workshops. The benefits I have received are innumerable and immeasurable. Nothing would please me more than to share what I have learned with others.

For more information, go to: https://sites.google.com/site/whisperingdeermeditation/

Upcoming Brahma Vihara workshop with Whispering Deer:

December 18, 2015: Brahma Vihara - Upeka (Equanimity) **************************

Most ingredients are organic and of the highest standards.

Come be in community

and enjoy the healthiest meal on planet earth!

Call (617)[masked] or e-mail [masked]
for reservations and directions.

Sliding scale of $20 - $35/meal.

Dana Gould is this years BCF Comedian of the Year, and before recieving that award Saturday he'll headlining The Gas at Great Scott! Dana Gould began his professional comedy career at the age of seventeen, and spent the next twenty years or so performing in the halcyon days of “The Comedy Boom.” Dana has multiple HBO specials to his credit as well guest appearances on The Late Show with David Letterman, Late Night With Conan O’Brien, and Real Time with Bill Maher. He has also made memorable appearances on The Ben Stiller Show, Seinfeld, Working, Anger Management, Mob City, Maron,and appeared in the film The Aristocrats. Dana co-created MTV’s Super Adventure Team, was a Co-Executive Producer and writer on The Simpsons, and a producer on NBC’s Parks and Recreation.

In 2009, Dana recorded his one-hour special, Let Me Put My Thoughts In You, and in 2013 recorded his next special, I Know It’s Wrong. His monthly podcast, The Dana Gould Hour, frequently resides in iTunes' top ten comedy downloads and he continues to perform regularly in and around Los Angeles

$20 advance, $22 at the door 18+

Join the Cambridge Water Department and research astronomer Dr. Joshua Roth for a glimpse at the heavens at Payson Park Reservoir in Belmont!

 Unbeknownst to many, this reservoir is the covered holding tank for purified drinking water before it is gravity-fed to Cambridge residents. Atop millions of gallons of water, we will explore the cosmos using telescopes, learning about the wonders of the night sky, how to identify seasonal constellations, and much more. 

Be sure to bundle up for the weather of the evening! All ages welcome. Please register for this event with [masked] for planning purposes. 

We’ll have lots of interactive indoor activities in the case of inclement weather!

I am honored to have this amazing filmmaker as a guest at Tree Of Life.  This event is being promoted to the general public and we expect a large turnout.


                Please RSVP directly to Jamil using the evite link below:


Jamil Simon is a documentary filmmaker who lives and works in Somerville. He is creating a powerful film, Fragile Island of Peace, about a unique peacebuilding process that happened in Burundi, a tiny country next door to Rwanda, during the past 12 years.

This is  a screening and a fundraiser but it is also a chance for us to think and talk about what it takes to achieve peace in this violent world. Jamil made this film because he believes strongly that we don't pay sufficient attention to nonviolent solutions to conflict. He will lead the discussion and invite the participation of expert peacebuilders with experience working on intractable conflicts in countries around the world.
