results.description:
There will be a stimulus for each meeting to inspire the conversation. The stimulus can be anything, such as a picture, a short story, a breaking news, etc. Each meeting includes stimulus introduction, small group and whole group discussion, and personal reflection. Every attendee is encouraged (actually required) to raise questions inspired by the stimulus. And then we will discuss why these questions are important; how these questions relate to one's personal life experience; what is one's perspectives on these questions, and how the discussion might affect one's future thinking. 

This is a place to share our souls and learn from others, NOT a place to promote any particular school of thoughts, beliefs, faiths, political views, etc. We must keep an open mind, respect each other, and agree to disagree. 

Recap of last meetup:

Eight members attended the last meetup. We had a group with a very diverse mix of age, gender, ethnicity, educational and professional background. This is a great advantage for a conversational meetup like Soulful Cafe, because we can learn so much more from other people with very different perspectives. 

Three stimuli were provided to this meetup: 

1. The portrait of a 15-year-old Afghan refugee, a girl who recently fled her country hoping to reach Sweden one day. Her only possession was a purse holding all the documents that her smugglers needed to cross borders. 

2. The story of a ninety-year-old woman from N.J. who has been motorcycling for 74 years. She plans to cross the country on a motorcycle at 100. 

3. The story of a 42-year-old guy, a chef from Cambridge who recently started riding motorcycle to free his soul. His wife didn’t have any objection; she said, “whatever makes him happy.” 

Here are some of the questions that the group had raised and discussed based on the stimuli: 


1. What makes you passionate: motorcycle? beauty? sex?

2. What is essential to life? 

3. What are you fear of making the changes you want in your life? 

4. What is immigrant? What is country?

5. What component is missing in your life that prevents you from moving forward to live a fuller life? (This was the group’s favorite question for the night.)

6. How much impulse control do we need? What is the cost of having too much impulse control? Can you bear the consequences of lack of impulse control?

7. What is the secret of happiness? 

8. What would you regret on your deathbed? (I don’t want to be on my deathbed. Period. Someone said)

9. Millennials are so busy connecting with others in the virtual world. Are they really connected? What is a real world? 

10. How to build deep and lasting friendships? 

11. What is identity? Does memory define our self identity? 

12. How should Europe integrate Muslim immigrants into the non-Islamic European culture? 

There were no “correct” answers to these questions. What really matters is to ask, to listen, and to ponder. 

I look forward to meeting more friends in our next meetup on November 15. 

Meeting Agenda: 7pm-9pm

1. Get your coffee and introduce yourselves: 10-15 minutes

2. Introduce the stimulus: 5 minutes

3. Small team discussion: 15 minutes

• What soulful question do you want to ask?

• Why is this question relevant/important to you?

• Vote on the question to submit to the whole group.

4. Group discussion: 45-60 minutes

• Each team submits a soulful question and explain why this question is relevant/important.

• Vote on which question to discuss within the whole group.

• In depth group discussion on the chosen question. The conversations should be related to one’s personal experience.

5. Individual reflection: 10 minutes

• What is your takeaway from today’s discussion?

• How will it affect your future thinking?

6. Conclusion and plan for next meeting: 5 minute
results.how_to_find_us: We will be at the back separate session of the dinning hall, which is accessible from the backdoor towards the parking lot. There will be a sign on the table saying "Soulful Cafe"

Are you sending message & after message on OKCupid or Match and not getting any responses?

Here's what we're going to do:

You and I are going to take a tour of your online dating profile via phone. I'll tell you if there are any red flags or bad buzzwords that might be keeping someone from hitting that message button. We'll look at your profile text, your photos and any other details that you share. We'll review everything together, and I'll tell you what might be sending the wrong impression. After this session, you're going to have more control and can go back to those days when you'd get excited before a first date. Just pick a time slot and register.

results.description:
It's week 8 of the 2015 Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing. FREE: The comedy club experience is called the Liquid Courage Comedy Club at Somerville Brewing Company. The brewery and destination-taproom, which opened in April of 2105, opens Sunday nights as a showcase style stand-up comedy club open to the public 21+ with no cover charge or ticket fee. Guests are able to order charcuterie boards, dinner and pints during, before and after the show. With a Sunday night show time of 9PM there is ample free parking is available.

Myq Kaplan is a comedian named Myq Kaplan (pronounced “Mike”). He is a 2010 Last Comic Standing Finalist and has appeared on the Tonight Show with Conan O’Brien, the Late Show with David Letterman, Comedy Central Presents, and all the other places he’s been. You can listen to Myq’s podcast, Hang Out With Me, on the Keith and The Girl network. His debut CD, Vegan Mind Meld, was one of iTunes’ top ten best-selling comedy albums in 2010, followed by Meat Robot in 2013 and his one-hour Netflix special Small Dork and Handsome in 2014.

The Comedians magazine calls him “a comedy machine, in the best possible way. the way that some machines vend soda or prevent other machines from killing future revolutionaries – that’s how Myq Kaplan does comedy: relentlessly, methodically, unblinkingly.”
results.name: Liquid Courage With Myq Kaplan

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
